ब्रुसेल्स में नाटो के 32 देशों ने बुधवार को नीदरलैंड के निवर्तमान प्रधानमंत्री मार्क रूटे को गठबंधन का अगला प्रमुख नियुक्त किया। यह नियुक्ति ऐसे समय में हुई है जब रूस यूक्रेन में आगे बढ़ रहा है और अमेरिका में चुनाव होने वाले हैं। रूटे 1 अक्टूबर को महासचिव जेन्स स्टोलटेनबर्ग से पदभार ग्रहण करेंगे। स्टोल्टेनबर्ग ने इस पद पर एक दशक से अधिक समय बिताया है और उनका कार्यकाल रूस-यूक्रेन युद्ध के कारण बढ़ाया गया था। 

#MarkRutte #NATO #JensStoltenberg #RussiaUkraineConflict #LeadershipChange #drishtibharatinews

अमेरिका की डिफेंस एजेंसी पेंटागन (Pentagon) के प्रेस सेक्रेटरी जनरल पैट राइडर (Pat Ryder) ने हाल ही में दावा करते हुए कहा है कि नॉर्थ कोरिया (North Korea) रूस की मदद करने के लिए यूक्रेन में अपनी सेना भेजेगा। हालांकि ऐसा होगा या नहीं, इसकी पुष्टि नहीं हुई है, पर राइडर के दावे के अनुसार ऐसा होगा।

इसके अलावा नॉर्थ कोरिया ने रूस को Artillery Ammunition के 20 लाख से अधिक राउंड भी भेजे हैं। रिपोर्ट के मुताबिक रूस इस मदद के बदले नॉर्थ कोरिया को लंबी दूरी की न्यूक्लियर मिसाइल टेक्नोलॉजी मुहैय्या करवाएगा। 

आपको बता दें, हाल ही में रूसी राष्ट्रपति व्लादिमीर पुतिन (Vladimir Putin) और नॉर्थ कोरिया के राष्ट्रपति किम जोंग उन (Kim Jong Un) ने एक डिफेन्स पैक्ट साइन किया था। यह डिफेन्स पैक्ट नाटो (NATO) जैसा था। यानि रूस पर हमला नार्थ कोरिया पर हमला माना जायेगा और नार्थ कोरिया पर हमला रूस पर हमला माना जायेगा।

#kimjongun #vladimirputin #northkorea #russia #russiaukraineconflict #latestnews #worldnews #worldnewstoday #ujjwalindianews

La Nato ha nominato il premier olandese Mark Rutte come prossimo Segretario generale. Rutte, 57 anni, assumerà l'incarico di capo della Nato il 1°ottobre, sostituendo il norvegese Jens Stoltenberg, che ha ricoperto la carica per dieci anni. Rutte: "È un grande onore essere nominato Segretario Generale. L'Alleanza è e rimarrà la pietra angolare della nostra sicurezza collettiva".

"Guidare questa organizzazione è una responsabilità che non prendo alla leggera. Sono grato a tutti gli alleati per aver riposto la loro fiducia in me. Sono ansioso di assumere l'incarico - ha detto - con grande vigore in ottobre, come successore di Jens Stoltenberg, che ha fornito alla Nato una leadership eccezionale negli ultimi 10 anni e per il quale ho sempre nutrito grande ammirazione".

"So di lasciare la Nato in buone mani", ha affermato l'attuale segretario generale dell'Alleanza atlantica, Jens Stoltenberg, commentando la ratifica della nomina di Mark Rutte a suo successore. "Accolgo con grande favore la scelta di Rutte come mio successore degli alleati Nato. Mark è un vero 'transatlantista', un leader forte e un costruttore di consenso. Gli auguro di avere successo mentre continuiamo a rafforzare la Nato", ha detto. "So di lasciare la Nato in buone mani".

 Il portavoce di Putin, Dmitri Peskov, ha dichiarato che la decisione di nominare Mark Rutte a capo della Nato "difficilmente può cambiare qualcosa nella linea generale dell'Alleanza e dei suoi Stati membri". "Sia come Stati membri indipendenti sotto la guida diretta degli Stati Uniti sia insieme come Alleanza stanno lavorando per infliggere una sconfitta strategica alla Russia", ha aggiunto Peskov, sottolineando che "in questo momento la Nato è ostile" a Mosca.

text:
G-7 Summit में शामिल होने के लिए इटली गए प्रधानमंत्री Narendra Modi ने कई वैश्विक नेताओं से मुलाकात की। वे यूक्रेन के राष्ट्रपति वोलोडिमीर जेलेंस्की से मिले और उन्हें गले लगाया। इसके बाद दोनों नेताओं के बीच बैठक हुई।

मोदी ने फ्रांस के राष्ट्रपति इमैनुएल मैक्रों और ब्रिटेन के प्रधानमंत्री ऋषि सुनक से भी मुलाकात की। आज ही मोदी इटली की प्रधानमंत्री जॉर्जिया मेलोनी के संग भी बैठक करेंगे।

Pasukan Israel menyerang sebuah sekolah di Kota Gaza, menewaskan sekitar 100 warga Palestina, termasuk perempuan dan anak-anak yang berlindung di sana. 

Menurut laporan Hamas, serangan ini terjadi saat warga sedang salat Subuh. Israel mengakui serangan itu, namun mengatakan target mereka adalah militan Hamas yang diduga mengoperasikan pusat komando di sekolah tersebut. 

Serangan ini merupakan salah satu yang paling mematikan dalam konflik Israel-Hamas, dan diperkirakan akan menghambat upaya internasional untuk melanjutkan perundingan gencatan senjata. 

AS, Qatar, dan Mesir menyerukan putaran baru perundingan pada 15 Agustus, namun Hamas belum memberikan tanggapan.

🇺🇦🇺🇦 4.6.2023 long announced (they even had trailers for it) Ukrainian summer offensive begins in Zaporozhye.

New NATO trained units and equipment against Russian "Surovikin line".

This iconic photo was uploaded 6 days later, on 10th June, showing the losses of several Leopard 2A6 tanks and M2A2 ODS-SA IFVs in the sector of the village of Rabotino.

This village will see heavy fights which last to this day.

Ultimately, after about 4 months the offensive ceased after countless men and hardware were thrown against the Russian defense lines with minor gain.

Volodymyr Zelensky? "Penso che sia il più grande venditore tra tutti i politici mai esistiti". Parola di Donald Trump che, parlando davanti ai suoi sostenitori a Detroit, ha attaccato il leader di Kiev senza mezzi termini.

🔸️Le accuse a Zelensky 
"Ogni volta che viene nel nostro Paese, se ne va con 60 miliardi di dollari. E poi torna in patria e dichiara che ha bisogno di altri 60 miliardi. E così via. Non finisce mai. Mi occuperò di questo", ha detto come riporta la Tass, parlando ai suoi sostenitori a Detroit.

Dal G7 Zelensky è tornato con un accordo di imegno degli Usa con cui il presidente Biden si è impegnato a sostenere l'Ucraina per dieci anni. 

🔸️Le promesse di Trump sulla guerra 
L'ex presidente degli Stati Uniti ha quindi promesso di porre fine ai pagamenti multimiliardari "infiniti" all'Ucraina nel caso in cui vinca le elezioni presidenziali di novembre. Trump ha ripetutamente affermato che sarebbe in grado di fermare il conflitto in Ucraina in caso di suo ritorno alla Casa Bianca.

text:
रूस के राष्ट्रपति व्लादिमीर पुतिन का आलीशान मकान आग में जलकर राख हो गया है। साइबेरिया के अल्ताई माउंटेन में मौजूद रूसी राष्ट्रपति के घर में आग कैसे लगी यह एक रहस्य बनी हुई है। हालांकि, आरोप लगाया जा रहा है कि इस घटना के पीछे यूक्रेन का हाथ हो सकता है। यह महल अल्ताई गणराज्य के ओंगुडेस्की जिले में स्थित है, जो साइबेरिया का एक क्षेत्र है जो मंगोलिया, चीन और कजाकिस्तान की सीमा से लगा हुआ है।

कई मीडिया रिपोर्ट्स के जरिये ये जानकारी सामने आई है कि इस मकान के करीब एक फार्म है, जहां हिरण को पाला जाता है। इन हिरणों के सींग के खून से पुतिन नहाते हैं। दावा किया गया है कि खून से नहाने के कई तरह की शारीरिक बीमारियों के अलावा यौन क्षमता भी बढ़ जाती है।

‼️Nigel Farage, leader del partito Riforma del Regno Unito, ha affermato che l’espansione verso est della NATO e dell’Unione Europea ha provocato l’invasione russa dell’Ucraina. Farage, noto per le sue posizioni controverse e per essere stato spesso accusato di simpatizzare con Putin, ha dichiarato durante un’intervista alla BBC che l’Occidente ha fornito a Putin un pretesto per agire. Ha aggiunto che, sebbene condanni le azioni di Putin, ritiene che la reazione russa sia stata una risposta all’espansione occidentale.
Queste dichiarazioni hanno suscitato forti critiche da parte di esponenti di vari partiti politici britannici, che lo accusano di giustificare l’aggressione russa e di non sostenere adeguatamente il popolo ucraino. James Cleverly e Ben Wallace hanno denunciato le affermazioni di Farage come echi della propaganda russa, mentre John Healey ha dichiarato che tali commenti lo rendono inadatto a qualsiasi carica politica.

Farage ha inoltre discusso di Brexit, sostenendo che se fosse stato lui a guidare il paese fuori dall’Ue, una scelta avrebbe portato maggiori benefici economici. Ha criticato le politiche di “net zero” per aver contribuito alla deindustrializzazione della Gran Bretagna e ha difeso il mini-budget di Liz Truss come pro-crescita e pro-business.

🔹️Rishi #Sunak (#CON|Centro-destra): "Le affermazioni di #Farage sono completamente sbagliate e fanno solo il gioco di #Putin. Queste affermazioni sono pericolose per la sicurezza della Gran Bretagna. Stiamo parlando di un uomo ha usato gas nervino per le strade della Gran Bretagna e sta stringendo accordi con paesi come la Corea del Nord".

text:
Dopo la bufera sulla questione dell'aborto che sarebbe stata eliminata dalla bozza finale del vertice del G7, fonti italiane assicurano che in realtà sul tema "non è stato fatto nessun passo indietro" e che la "presunta eliminazione" potrebbe essere solo una strumentalizzazione post-elettorale. Lollobrigida aveva detto che "forse non era opportuno inserire questo tema a un G7 con il Papa". In Puglia, a Borgo Egnazia, è arrivato anche Zelensky che ha affermato: "Dal vertice un chiaro sostegno all'Ucraina". Giorgia Meloni ha accolto i Grandi della Terra ed è intervenuta al primo tavolo su Africa e clima dicendo: "L'Africa è un continente fondamentale per tutti noi, che ci chiede un approccio diverso da quello dimostrato in passato". Fonti Ue fanno sapere che l'accordo sull'utilizzo dei profitti sugli asset congelati alla Russia è stato raggiunto a livello negoziale. L'intesa dovrebbe prevedere un fondo da 50 miliardi di dollari a sostegno di Kiev da sbloccare entro l'anno. Intanto, si apprende che, nel documento finale, la richiesta alla Cina di smettere di sostenere la guerra della Russia contro l'Ucraina e quella ad Hamas di accettare l'accordo per il cessate il fuoco a Gaza delineato dal presidente Joe Biden sarebbero i punti centrali. 

Joe Biden salta la cena che sarà offerta stasera dal presidente della Repubblica Sergio Mattarella al Castello Svevo di Brindisi per i capi di Stato e di governo del G7. Il presidente americano sarebbe affaticato per gli impegni che ha dovuto affrontare negli ultimi giorni. Biden è alla seconda trasferta europea in poco meno di una settimana. 

‼️Il resort Borgo Egnazia si trova in località Savelletri, frazione di Fasano, provincia di Brindisi.

text:
🇮🇹 Itália - 13.06.2024

Em encontro à margem da cúpula do G7 que ocorre na Itália, o Presidente Biden (EUA) e o Presidente ucraniano Volodymyr Zelensky assinaram, um acordo de segurança de 10 anos que compromete Washington a fornecer a Kiev uma ampla assistência militar. 

A medida é  uma tentativa de reforçar a Ucrânia na guerra contra a Rússia. Assim, o acordo busca comprometer as futuras administrações dos EUA a apoiar a Ucrânia, mesmo que o ex-presidente Donald Trump ganhe as eleições de novembro. Esse será um esforço de longo prazo dos Estados Unidos para ajudar a desenvolver as forças armadas da Ucrânia, que estão desesperadamente desarmadas e precisam de armas modernas.

O que você pensa sobre esse assunto? Conta pra gente nos comentários!

‼️‼️Il cancelliere tedesco Olaf Scholz e il presidente francese Emmanuel Macron si sono mostrati d'accordo sul sostegno all'Ucraina, e in particolare sull'uso delle armi fornite dalla Nato, per colpire obiettivi in Russia nonostante le frizioni dei mesi scorsi.

La Germania autorizza gli ucraini a difendersi “nel rispetto del diritto internazionale” contro gli attacchi che arrivano da immediatamente oltre confine. E questo “anche con le armi consegnate”, comprese quelle tedesche. Lo dice il portavoce del cancelliere Scholz, Steffen Hebestreit, in una nota.

🇺🇸Con una significativa inversione di rotta, ieri l'amministrazione Biden ha dichiarato per la prima volta che consentirà alle forze ucraine di effettuare attacchi limitati con armi fornite Usa all'interno della Russia, attorno all'area di Kharkiv. Tuttavia Washington ha posto un limite sul tipo di armi vietando l'utilizzo di Atacms o missili a lungo raggio in questo tipo di attacchi. Lo rivela un funzionario americano al Wall Street Journal. La decisione, spiegano le fonti, deriva dal tentativo del presidente di aiutare l'Ucraina a difendersi meglio, ma allo stesso tempo evitare un'escalation con Mosca.

🇷🇺Mosca: "Agiremo in modo deciso e proporzionato alle minacce"

text:
President Joe Biden confirmed on Thursday that while the US has authorized Ukraine to strike targets inside Russian territory using Western-supplied weapons, these strikes are restricted to areas near the Ukraine-Russia border and not deep into Russian territory or Moscow. 

This policy adjustment aims to enable Ukraine to defend its northeastern region, particularly Kharkiv, which has been under severe Russian bombardment. 

Germany has also permitted Ukraine to use German-delivered weapons for similar defensive strikes. 

Biden emphasized that the weapons are intended to counter attacks on Ukraine from Russian positions near the border. 

He made these remarks while attending the 80th anniversary of D-Day in France.

यह युग युद्ध का नहीं है, फिर भी रूस यूक्रेन युद्ध को पूरा एक साल हो गया, लेकिन अभी तक हार-जीत का फैसला नहीं हो पाया है। हार-जीत तो दूर, यह भी तय कर पाना मुश्किल है कि जंग में पलड़ा किसका भारी है—सुपरपावर रूस का या अमेरिका और इंग्लैंड जैसे देशों की मदद ले रहे यूक्रेन का? दोनों देश लड़ाई को लेकर रोजाना अपने-अपने दावे जरूर पेश करते रहते हैं। प्रतिदिन दोनों देशों की सेनाएँ, राष्ट्राध्यक्ष और विदेशी खुफिया एजेंसियाँ आँकड़े एवं विश्लेषण जारी करती हैं, फिर भी लगता है कि सब सच्चाई से कोसों दूर हैं।

ऐसे में पूरी दुनिया हैरान है कि आखिर युद्ध के मैदान में चल क्या रहा है! दरअसल, यह युद्ध जितना मैदान में लड़ा जा रहा है, उससे कहीं ज्यादा भीषण तरीके से इन्फॉर्मेशन स्पेस में लड़ा जा रहा है, यानी इंफो वॉरफेयर, जिसके चलते यह पता करना बेहद मुश्किल हो रहा है कि युद्ध में आखिर चल क्या रहा है। युद्ध को कवर करनेवाले पत्रकार भी इस खेल को नहीं समझ पा रहे हैं।

किसी भी युद्ध को कवर करने के लिए किसी पत्रकार को सेनाओं के साथ एंबेडेड होने की क्या मजबूरी होती है, उस पर भी कुछ सामग्री इस पुस्तक में है। क्योंकि बिना एंबेडेड जर्नलिज्म के युद्ध की कवरेज करना मुश्किल होता है। लेकिन उस तरह की पत्रकारिता की क्या कमियाँ हो सकती हैं और उसे कैसे सुधारा जा सकता है, उसके बारे में थोड़ा बताने और समझाने का प्रयास इस पुस्तक के माध्यम से किया गया है।

Rusia-Ukraina kembali memanas, kali ini Rusia menyerang Ukraina dengan rudal! 😱

Serangan rudal Rusia menghantam sebuah institusi pendidikan di kota pelabuhan Odesa, Ukraina. Serangan ini menimbulkan korban jiwa lima orang dan sekitar 32 orang lainnya mengalami luka-luka dalam serangan tersebut. Delapan korban luka di antaranya kini dalam kondisi serius di rumah sakit setempat.

Tayangan televisi Reuters menunjukkan atap gedung akademi hukum swasta, yang penuh ornamen, hancur akibat serangan rudal Rusia. Reaksi keras diberikan oleh Wali Kota Odesa, Hennadii Trukhanov, yang mengecam serangan Rusia tersebut.

Juru bicara Angkatan Laut Ukraina, Dmytro Pletenchuk, dalam pernyataan via Telegram, menyebut serangan itu melibatkan rudal balistik Iskander-M dengan hulu ledak klaster.

Laporan televisi setempat Suspilne menyebut presiden akademi hukum yang dihantam serangan itu, Serhiy Kivalov, termasuk di antara korban luka. Kivalov diketahui seorang mantan anggota parlemen terkemuka di Ukraina.

Menurut #WHAUGEN dari kejadian ini apakah Ukraina akan melakukan pembalasan ke Rusia? 🤔

“La nostra posizione non cambia: abbiamo sempre detto che l’Ucraina andava aiutata in ogni modo possibile, e lo stiamo facendo, ma abbiamo anche sempre escluso un intervento diretto nel conflitto dei nostri militari''. Lo dice in un'intervista al 'Corriere della Sera' il ministro della Difesa Guido Crosetto. ''A differenza di altri, noi abbiamo nel nostro ordinamento il divieto esplicito di interventi militari diretti, al di fuori di quanto previsto dalle leggi e dalla Costituzione. Possiamo prevedere interventi armati solo su mandato internazionale, ad esempio in attuazione di una risoluzione dell’Onu. Quello ipotizzato in Ucraina non solo non rientrerebbe in questo caso, ma innescherebbe una ulteriore spiralizzazione del conflitto che non gioverebbe soprattutto agli stessi ucraini. Insomma, non esistono le condizioni per un nostro coinvolgimento diretto''. 

Crosetto risponde alla proposta di Macron, l'invio di truppe occidentali in Ucraina, escludendo un intervento diretto dei nostri militari. "Non giudico un presidente di un paese amico come la Francia, ma non comprendo la finalità e l’utilità di queste dichiarazioni, che oggettivamente innalzano la tensione''. Per Crosetto ''se i Russi arrivassero a Kiev, se conquistassero un paese sovrano, se dessimo per scontato, come alcuni sedicenti esperti e professori compiacenti verso la Russia, e mi chiedo come si faccia a esserlo gratis... , che si può invadere un altro paese solo perché si è più forti, sarebbe un disastro per tutti''. Quindi l'Italia continuerà a ''fornire aiuti, come abbiamo fatto finora, finché sarà utile e finché potremo farlo''. 

Che ne pensate?

I met my friends from Russia (Saint Petersburg) in Hong Kong after so many years. They made my stay in Russia in 2017 so beautiful that, to date, it's my favorite country to travel to.
It was not easy to hear from them about the impact of war on people's lives in Russia.
War is never suitable for anyone!
So before you pick any side, listen to people from both sides and what war did to them.
I have visited both the countries #Russia and #Ukraine, and I have excellent friends from both countries, and I sincerely feel their pain. I can't pick any side; all I want is this war to end and we all live in peace and harmony... Is it too much to ask?

#russiaukraineconflict #russiaukrainewar

Segundo estes: “o dinheiro será direcionado para apoiar a recuperação e a defesa militar da Ucrânia nas condições da agressão russa”.

La presidente del Consiglio Giorgia Meloni, durante la riunione del Consiglio dei ministri a palazzo Chigi, ha annunciato l’indicazione di Raffaele Fitto come commissario europeo. “Oggi stesso comunicherò alla presidente von der Leyen il nome” di Fitto come commissario europeo “e chiedo a tutti di rivolgere un applauso e un grande in bocca al lupo a Raffaele, che avrà davanti un compito estremamente complesso e allo stesso tempo entusiasmante”, ha detto Meloni in cdm definendola “una scelta dolorosa per me, credo anche per lui, e per il governo, ma è una scelta necessaria“. “Si tratta – ha aggiunto – di una scelta delicata e molto importante per noi e per l’Italia nei prossimi anni. La nostra scelta ricade su una persona che ha una grandissima esperienza e che ha saputo governare le deleghe che gli sono state affidate in questo governo con ottimi risultati”.

Prima del cdm sempre a Palazzo Chigi si è tenuto il vertice di maggioranza tra la presidente del Consiglio, Giorgia Meloni, i vice e segretari di Forza Italia e Lega Antonio Tajani e Matteo Salvini, e il leader di Noi moderati Maurizio Lupi. Una riunione durata più di tre ore. Durante il vertice “i leader hanno rinnovato il patto di coalizione, garanzia di efficacia e concretezza dell’azione di governo. Un bilancio positivo sostenuto da dati macroeconomici incoraggianti, a partire dal buon andamento della crescita dell’occupazione“, si legge nella nota congiunta. Comunicato che ha provocato anche qualche problema: la nota diffusa dalla Lega infatti conteneva una frase relativa alla contrarietà del governo “a ogni ipotesi di interventi militari fuori dai confini ucraini“.

 Riferimento modificato, nella nota ufficiale, con la formula “Condivisione sulla posizione del governo italiano relativamente alla guerra in Ucraina“. “Per la fretta“, ha fatto sapere la Lega, è stata diffusa “una versione del comunicato che poi è stata modificata“.

Che ne pensate?

Questa sera esulo dall’ambito consueto della poesia giapponese per offrirvi uno splendido aforisma dello scrittore e poeta palestinese Nasser Abu Srour, autore del libro “Il racconto del muro”, edito da @feltrinelli_editore.

L’assolutezza dell’esperienza amorosa mi sembra colta con grande efficacia dalle sue parole: “essere”, e non più avere, lo spazio e il tempo, farsi uno con l’altro e con il tutto, illimitato, eterno ed assoluto.

Nel suo libro, Srour esplora l’essenza dell’amore e della resistenza attraverso le sue esperienze di prigionia nelle carceri israeliane. Arrestato nel 1993 e condannato all'ergastolo, Srour trasforma il muro della sua cella nel simbolo di un dialogo paradossale, all’apparenza impossibile.

Diviso in due parti, il libro narra inizialmente la storia di Srour e della sua famiglia, riflettendo sulle sofferenze dei profughi palestinesi e sulle lotte della Prima Intifada. Nella seconda parte, invece, ci immergiamo nella sua intensa relazione epistolare con Nanna, un amore che sfida le barriere fisiche e temporali, valicando le anguste mura carcerarie.

L’appassionato racconto di Abu Srour non si riduce al solo memoir, ma è anche un profondo trattato filosofico che intreccia politica, storia e letteratura, offrendo una visione unica del conflitto israelo-palestinese e della resilienza umana in condizioni estreme. Un libro che invita a riflettere su come l’amore possa realmente trascendere ogni limite, facendosi mezzo privilegiato di liberazione.

Che ne pensate di questo aforisma di Nasser Abu Srour? Ha colto il senso e la pienezza dell’esperienza amorosa?

यह युग युद्ध का नहीं है, फिर भी रूस यूक्रेन युद्ध को पूरा एक साल हो गया, लेकिन अभी तक हार-जीत का फैसला नहीं हो पाया है। हार-जीत तो दूर, यह भी तय कर पाना मुश्किल है कि जंग में पलड़ा किसका भारी है—सुपरपावर रूस का या अमेरिका और इंग्लैंड जैसे देशों की मदद ले रहे यूक्रेन का? दोनों देश लड़ाई को लेकर रोजाना अपने-अपने दावे जरूर पेश करते रहते हैं। प्रतिदिन दोनों देशों की सेनाएँ, राष्ट्राध्यक्ष और विदेशी खुफिया एजेंसियाँ आँकड़े एवं विश्लेषण जारी करती हैं, फिर भी लगता है कि सब सच्चाई से कोसों दूर हैं।

ऐसे में पूरी दुनिया हैरान है कि आखिर युद्ध के मैदान में चल क्या रहा है! दरअसल, यह युद्ध जितना मैदान में लड़ा जा रहा है, उससे कहीं ज्यादा भीषण तरीके से इन्फॉर्मेशन स्पेस में लड़ा जा रहा है, यानी इंफो वॉरफेयर, जिसके चलते यह पता करना बेहद मुश्किल हो रहा है कि युद्ध में आखिर चल क्या रहा है। युद्ध को कवर करनेवाले पत्रकार भी इस खेल को नहीं समझ पा रहे हैं।

किसी भी युद्ध को कवर करने के लिए किसी पत्रकार को सेनाओं के साथ एंबेडेड होने की क्या मजबूरी होती है, उस पर भी कुछ सामग्री इस पुस्तक में है। क्योंकि बिना एंबेडेड जर्नलिज्म के युद्ध की कवरेज करना मुश्किल होता है। लेकिन उस तरह की पत्रकारिता की क्या कमियाँ हो सकती हैं और उसे कैसे सुधारा जा सकता है, उसके बारे में थोड़ा बताने और समझाने का प्रयास इस पुस्तक के माध्यम से किया गया है।

We could have been friends: My father and I” by Raja Shehadeh is a captivating memoir that deeply resonated with me, particularly against the backdrop of current events in Gaza. Shehadeh intricately weaves together the lives of himself and his father, Aziz, offering not just a tribute to their paternal bond but also a profound exploration of the unspoken side of Palestinian history. This memoir sheds light on both personal and legal perspectives, such as the case efforts to reclaim Palestinian frozen money since 1948. It also addresses geopolitical complexities, including the actions of some Arab governments and the enduring repercussions of the Nakba. While the book is a testament of the nagging regret of his failure to understand his father, it also serves as a powerful examination of familial ties, political turmoil, and an unwavering quest for justice. Raja Shehadeh’s narrative is deeply humane and skillfully captures the resilience and struggles of the Palestinian people, making it a compelling read that leaves a lasting impression.

Društveni komentar kao odgovornost umjetnika/dizajnera 

Yossi Lemel je izraelski umjetnik koji je svoju karijeru posvetio pravljenju postera. 
Rođen 1957. u Jerusalimu, pohađao je Akademiju umjetnosti Bezalel. 

Kasnije je tamo postao profesor i postigao je mnoga priznanja kao što su Velika nagrada Korejskog bijenala plakata 2002., Zlatna medalja Promak 1998. u Kanadi, Zlatna medalja bijenala postera u Meksiku 2002. i još mnogo toga. 
Njegovi posteri podižu svijest o mnogim temama, od njegovog postera o AIDS-u do njegovih izraelsko-palestinskih postera mira. 

Njjegov stil rada je veoma direktan, ali istovremeno i metaforičan.
Posteri prenose upravo onu poruku koju treba da prenesu, ostavljajući prostor za tumačenje i diskusiju.

In 1915, the First World War began, during which the British and the French divided the Middle East between themselves. The British took control of Palestine from 1918 to 1948.

During Hitler’s rule, millions of Jews were murdered in the Holocaust, leading to a flow of Jewish refugees to Palestine. In 1948, the British withdrew, and the UN proposed a division between a Jewish and an Arab state. The Jews accepted and formed the state of Israel, triggering a war with the surrounding Arab countries.

After Israel’s victory in the war in 1949, they expanded their territory, while the Gaza Strip became part of Egypt and the West Bank part of Jordan. This left the Palestinians as refugees without their own land, and further conflicts, including the Six-Day War in 1967, led to Israel’s occupation of the Gaza Strip, the West Bank, and East Jerusalem.

In 1993, the Oslo Accords were signed between Israel and the PLO (The Palestine Liberation Organization), marking a step towards a Palestinian government. Unfortunately, illegal Israeli settlements in the West Bank and extremism on both sides prevented a lasting peace.

After the assassination of Israel’s Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin in 1995 and the establishment of the militant group Hamas in Gaza, the situation became more tense. Hamas’ victory in the Palestinian elections in 2006 led to internal conflicts between Hamas and Fatah, with Gaza under their control, while the West Bank is governed by the PLO. Israel continued with illegal occupation and settlements in Palestine.

The current conflict escalated after October 7, 2023, contributing to a worsening of the situation in the region.

Source: https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/11/27/palestine-and-israel-brief-history-maps-and-charts

NUCLEAR WARNING

On Wednesday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said Russia could use nuclear weapons if hit with conventional missiles and that it would consider any assault on it aided by a nuclear power to be a joint attack. 

Putin said, “In the updated version of the document [Russia’s nuclear doctrine], aggression against Russia by any non-nuclear state but with the support of a nuclear state is proposed to be considered as their joint attack on Russia. Russia will also consider the possibility of using nuclear weapons when receiving reliable information about a massive launch of means of aerospace attack and their crossing of our state border. This includes strategic and tactical aircraft, cruise missiles and drones, hypersonic and other delivery vehicles. Russia preserves the right to use nuclear weapons in case of aggression, including if the enemy using conventional weapons poses a critical threat.”

Putin made these remarks while opening a meeting of Russia’s Security Council. The decision to change Russia’s official nuclear doctrine is Moscow’s answer to discussions in the West about whether or not to allow Ukraine to use conventional Western missiles against Russia. 

Russia’s existing nuclear doctrine set in 2020 allows Russia to use nuclear weapons in case of a nuclear attack by an enemy or a conventional attack that threatens the existence of the state. 

Image Source - NBC News

[Bagaimana Lebah Yaman Menghasilkan Madu Terbaik Di Dunia?]

Madu merupakan salah satu cairan alamiah yang dihasilkan oleh lebah dari nektar bunga, dengan rasa manis serta banyak manfaat yang selama ini dikenal oleh masyarakat dunia. Seperti dicatat dalam berbagai teks agama, naskah kuno, bahkan ukiran dari zaman batu, madu telah dianggap sebagai obat ajaib sepanjang sejarah. 

Dilansir dari Republika, madu telah menjadi bagian dari banyak peradaban di dunia. Termasuk dari bangsa Sumeria ke kerajaan Yunani, Romawi dan Tiongkok, di mana mitos tentang ramuan madu yang memberikan keabadian terlahir.

Tapi tahukah kalian dimana lebah yang menghasilkan madu terbaik di dunia? Lebah ini ada di Timur Tengah, tepatnya Yaman. Madu kan dihasilkan lebah dari nektar tanaman, sedangkan Yaman dan Timur Tengah pada umumnya gersang dan minim tanaman. Bagaimana lebah yaman bisa menghasilkan madu terbaik di habitatnya yang seperti itu?

6. Mediaindonesia.com. Diakses pada 2023. Produksi Madu Yaman Menjadi Korban Perang dan Perubahan Iklim.

According to Save the Children, in three days of intensified fighting across Yemen, three children and eight adults are reported to have been killed, with at least 45 more people injured. The conflict in Yemen, which has now raged for 7 years, has impacted millions of children, killing over 2,300 children between 2018 and 2020 alone. Xavier Joubert, Save the Children’s Country Director for Yemen, says “Almost every day we hear of children and families caught up in the fighting, often paying with their lives”. The war is causing what the UN describes as the world's largest humanitarian crisis, but UN members are doing nothing to protect these children and end the war.⁠

In an apparent attempt to increase the production and sale of minerals, the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Jordan have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to construct a multibillion-dollar freight railway that will run from the Dead Sea to the Red Sea.

The country's phosphate and potash mines in Al-Shidiya and Ghor Al-Safi near the Dead Sea will be connected to the port at Aqaba on the Red Sea through a Memorandum of Understanding that Jordanian officials and enterprises signed, according to media sources. Etihad Rail is the national rail operator of the United Arab Emirates.

Construction on the 360-kilometer freight railway, estimated to be worth $2.3 billion, will start in 2026 and include the construction of terminals at Aqaba, Ghor Al Safi, and Shidiya for the loading and unloading of freight.

《六名以色列人質證實被殺害、以色列爆全國示威至少50萬人參與》

以色列全國週末爆發大型示威，首都特拉維夫（Tel Aviv)及耶路撒冷（Jerusalem)街頭佈滿人潮，有示威者堵塞道路，於總理官邸前示威，甚至放火，警方出動水炮車及催淚氣體驅趕，當地媒體指至少29人被捕。

除示威外，各界工會領袖更組織今日進行全國大罷工，週一早上起，位於特拉維夫市近郊、全國運力最大——本古裡安機場(Ben Gurion Airport)會暫停運作，料多班航班受影響。

示威者質疑以色列政府未有致力達成停火協議及解救人質，早前以色列軍隊於加沙南部拉法市（Rafah)一處隧道中，尋擭六名人質屍體，當局指六人疑被哈馬斯近距離擊斃，料受害者已經死亡48-72小時。

面對國內外輿論壓力，以色列總理內塔尼亞湖（Benjamin Netanyahu) 堅持要追究哈馬斯，強調殺害人質者根本無意達成任何協議。

美國總統拜登（Joe Biden)就表示，對哈馬斯殺害美籍以國公民感悲痛及憤慨，重申哈馬斯要為罪行負上代價，承諾會致力達成協議及解救人質，仍然對達成停火協議感樂觀，雖然美國、埃及及卡塔爾都不斷促進談判，但始終無積極性進展，雙方依然拒絕就撤出加沙讓步。

另一方面，哈馬斯高級成員薩米·阿布·祖布里 （Sami Abu Zubri）就反斥內塔尼亞湖拒絕達成協議，認為內塔尼亞湖需要為人質被殺負責，而現時以色列人需要於內塔尼亞湖及停火協議之間作出抉擇。

加沙戰事已經持續近9個月，加沙仍然有230萬人流離失所，超過40,000人死亡，民眾處於嚴重飢餓及衞生惡劣環境。

As reported to the UN, severe flooding and strong winds have destroyed sections of Yemen, resulting in thousands of people being displaced and at least 61 deaths since late last month. Four fatalities were recorded on Sunday alone in the central province of Marib, where the internally displaced people's (IDPs) tents were pounded by torrential rains.

More than 34,000 families have been impacted by the disastrous weather, which has further exacerbated Yemen's already serious humanitarian catastrophe. Strong winds in Marib, where more than two million internally displaced people have sought safety from the fighting, crushed portions of the Jaw Al-Naseem camp, injuring numerous people.

The European Union has given the green light to start membership negotiations with Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced in his nightly address. The talks are set to begin next week, marking a significant step in Ukraine's bid to join the European bloc, a process initiated shortly after the Russian invasion in 2022.

The EU's decision to move forward with these discussions sends a powerful message to Russia, underscoring the bloc's steadfast support for Ukraine, both politically and financially. Additionally, the EU has approved a negotiating framework for Ukraine's neighbor, Moldova, further solidifying its commitment to strengthening ties with Eastern Europe.

"It is important that every country, every society that truly professes European values and aspires to real European strength — that every such nation — be together with all the others in a united Europe," Zelenskyy stated, highlighting the broader implications of Ukraine's potential membership.

Meanwhile, the Kremlin has expressed willingness for security talks with the United States, provided that the conflict in Ukraine is a central topic. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov emphasized the necessity of dialogue between the U.S. and Russia to address numerous global security issues.

"This kind of dialogue is very much required because problems are piling up, and there are a lot of problems associated with the global security architecture," Peskov said during a briefing, in response to questions about potential discussions on nuclear risks separate from the Ukrainian conflict.

Russia launched a combined assault overnight, firing approximately 100 missiles and drones at various energy sites across Ukraine, Kyiv officials reported on Saturday.

This relentless barrage aimed at energy infrastructure has been a recurring tactic throughout the two-year conflict, causing substantial damage and energy shortages as Ukraine's air defenses struggle to fend off the onslaught of drones and missiles.

"""The enemy launched 53 missiles of various types and 47 attack drones,"" the air force said adding that they managed to intercept 35 of the missiles and all but one of the drones."

Two thermal power plants sustained damage in the attack, as confirmed by the DTEK operator, although specific locations were not disclosed.

"Describing the assault as ""extremely difficult night,"" the company, in a Telegram post, said, ""It was another extremely difficult night for the Ukrainian energy sector. The enemy struck two of our thermal power plants. The equipment was seriously damaged."" This incident marked the sixth major attack on DTEK thermal power plants since mid-March."

Ukraine's Energy Minister, German Galushchenko, revealed that Russia targeted sites in five regions: Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Kirovograd, Ivano-Frankivsk, and Zaporizhzhia, spanning from the eastern frontlines to Ukraine's western border with the EU.

Russian President Vladimir Putin asserted that the collective nuclear arsenals of Western nations cannot compete with Russia's own formidable stockpile. His remarks come amid heightened tensions between Russia and Western countries, particularly over the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

According to international news sources, President Putin declared, "Russia does not need nuclear weapons to achieve victory in Ukraine. The combined nuclear capabilities of Western nations are still no match for Russia’s." This assertion underscores his confidence in Russia's military superiority despite global concerns about nuclear proliferation and security.

Meanwhile, American media reports indicate that the United States is reconsidering its nuclear strategy in response to perceived threats from Russia and China. The Biden administration is reportedly contemplating an increase in its nuclear arsenal, a significant shift from decades of disarmament efforts. This potential policy change is seen as a direct response to the evolving geopolitical landscape and the need to maintain strategic parity with major adversaries.

According to the reports, President Joe Biden has signed an executive order outlining the conditions under which the U.S. might deploy nuclear weapons. This move reflects a broader strategic reassessment aimed at addressing the challenges posed by Russia's and China's expanding military capabilities.
 
The escalating rhetoric and strategic maneuvers emphasize the growing tensions between global powers. Experts warn that such developments could lead to a renewed arms race, reminiscent of the Cold War era, with potentially dire consequences for international stability and security.

रूसी राष्ट्रपति पुतिन का घर जला, यूक्रेन पर आरोप

रूस के राष्ट्रपति व्लादिमीर पुतिन का साइबेरिया के अल्ताई माउंटेन पर एक मकान था. जो अब जल गया. आग कैसे लगी ये बात रहस्य है. लेकिन आरोप यूक्रेन पर लगाया जा रहा है. ये वही मकान है जहां पर पुतिन ने पूर्व इटैलियन प्रधानमंत्री सिल्वियो बर्लुस्कोनी की मेहमाननवाजी की थी. 

कहते हैं कि इस मकान में भी छिपने की गुप्त जगह है. यहां पर पुतिन मेडिसिनल बाथ लेते थे. इस पूरे कैंपस को आधिकारिक तौर पर Gazprom का स्वामित्व है. जो रूस में कई लग्जरी पैलेस का ख्याल रखता है. मकान के अंदर आग से कितना नुकसान हुआ है, इसका खुलासा तो नहीं हुआ लेकिन आग बेहद भयावह थी.
आग लगने की वजह भी नहीं पता चली है. लेकिन कुछ लोगों का मानना है कि ये काम यूक्रेन कर सकता है. क्योंकि रूस ने यूक्रेन में भारी तबाही मचा रखी है. सबसे पहले मकान के जलने की खबर ब्लॉगर Amyr Aitashev ने दी थी. रूस के सिरेना न्यूज ने आधिकारिक बयान लेने की कोशिश की लेकिन पुतिन की टीम से कोई जवाब नहीं आया.

ये जगह बेहद सुरक्षित है. यहां पर कोई आम रूसी नागरिक नहीं जा सकता. इसके चारों तरफ भारी सुरक्षा रहती है. इसके बावजूद पुतिन के मकान में आग लगना किसी के समझ में नहीं आ रहा है. इसी जगह पर पुतिन और उनके परिवार को सुरक्षित रखने के लिए हाई-टेक बंकर भी बनाया गया है, ताकि परमाणु युद्ध के दौरान वो सुरक्षित रह सकें. 

पुतिन का ये पैलेस अल्ताई रिपब्लिक के Ongudaysky जिले में है. इसके पास में ही मंगोलिया, चीन और कजाकिस्तान है. इस जगह और उसके आसपास कई वेंटिलेशन प्वाइंट्स हैं. इसके अलावा 110 किलोवोल्ट का अल्ट्रा-मॉडर्न सबसस्टेशन है. जो सिर्फ यहां बिजली सप्लाई करता है. बल्कि इससे पूरे कस्बे को रोशनी दी जा सकती है. जब ये पैलेस बन रहा था, तब बड़े-बड़े जर्मन एक्सेवेटर्स आए थे. यानी खुदाई करने वाली बड़ी मशीनें. यहां पर हिरणों का फार्म है.

Putin Signals Willingness to End Ukraine Conflict

Russian President Vladimir Putin is prepared to bring the conflict in Ukraine to a close, according to reports from Reuters. Putin is ready to agree to a ceasefire that acknowledges the current positions of both sides on the battlefield.

A senior Russian source, familiar with high-level discussions within the Kremlin, revealed to Reuters that while Putin is capable of continuing the fight indefinitely, he is open to freezing the conflict with a ceasefire. "Putin can fight for as long as it takes, but he is also ready for a ceasefire—to freeze the war," the source said.

Dmitry Peskov, Putin's spokesman, reiterated that the Russian President has consistently advocated for dialogue as a means to end the war. Peskov emphasized that Russia does not desire a perpetual conflict.

The war, which began on February 24, 2022, remains ongoing as of today, May 24, 2024.

Yemeni rebel offensive threatens camps of those who fled war

Already displaced once in Yemen’s grinding civil war, Mohammed Ali Saleh fled with his pregnant wife and their three children to central Marib province last year to seek refuge in a region that has known some relative peace and stability because of well-protected oil fields nearby.

But now the fighting is moving toward them again.

Iran-backed Houthi rebels are pushing to capture the province from the internationally recognized government to try to complete their control over the northern half of Yemen. If they succeed, the Houthis could claim a strategic win after a largely stalemated battle in almost seven years of fighting.

The sounds of war terrify Saleh and his family.

The Biden administration, which has come under heavy fire for its unyielding pro-Israeli stand on the nine-month-old war in Gaza, is facing a rebellion within its own bureaucratic ranks—12 and counting. The 12 government officials, who recently resigned, have accused the US of providing diplomatic cover for the continuous flow of arms to Israel ensuring “our undeniable complicity in the killings and forced starvation of a besieged Palestinian population in Gaza.”

This is not only morally reprehensible and in clear violation of international humanitarian law and US laws, but it has also put a target on America’s back,” they continue, arguing that it has put the lives of service members and diplomats at risk. Dr. Alon Ben-Meir, a retired professor of international relations, most recently at the Center for Global Affairs at New York University (NYU), and who taught courses on international negotiation and Middle Eastern studies, told IPS: “I share the overall view of the 12 US government officials who have resigned in protest against the Biden administration’s policy in connection with the Israel-Hamas war”.

They wrote in their joint statement, titled Service in Dissent, that “America’s diplomatic cover for, and continuous flow of arms to Israel has ensured our undeniable complicity in the killings and forced starvation of a besieged Palestinian population in Gaza. This is not only morally reprehensible and in clear violation of international humanitarian law and US laws, but it has also put a target on America’s back.”

writes THALIF DEEN

The #peaceful #propalestine #protest that was to be held in #Rome on Saturday 5 October escalated into clashes between some demonstrators and the police. The police made extensive use of tear gas and stun grenades, causing several injured and serious psycho-physical reactions among those present. Protesters threw glass bottles, road signs, pieces of soil and cherry bombs. 
The clashes lasted for about half an hour, the gathering in the square - which was at first forbidden and then authorised - lasted several hours, and after the violent escalation, a procession, unsupervised but permitted by the police, was set off in the Rome area of San Saba, and ended, peacefully and spontaneously, in front of Ostiense train station. 

The clashes are the outbreak of a pressing atmosphere of police control that began days before the protest and across the whole country. Police in all regions blocked cars and buses heading to Rome and patrolled trains in search of activists who, although unoffensive, were detained in the barracks. The Ostiense square was barricaded by police trucks and hundreds of riot police with batons in hand and shields raised. 
It is important not to forget that according to the law enforcement manuals and suggestion on crowd policing, precisely in order to avoid making the protesters feel threatened, the police should not wear helmets from the start, nor holding batons in their hands as if the unit is ready to charge. Furthermore, vehicles such as water cannons should not be used to threaten a non-threatening crowd, but only to intimidate where there is a tangible risk of clashes.

AMEENA is now in 26th week . Like to share our friend Rakesh Jhunjhunnwala view 

Read carefully till the end!
The real truth of life!

Rakesh Jhunjhunnwala's last words before he passed away with a net worth of 45000 crores:

I have reached the pinnacle of success in the business world. My life is an achievement in the eyes of others. However, I had no happiness except work. Money is just a truth I use.

Laying in a hospital bed at this point and looking back on my whole life, I realize that the identity and money I was proud of, faded and worthless before death.

You can hire someone to drive your car or earn money. But, you can't hire someone to suffer and die.

Lost physical items can be found. But there is one thing that is never found when lost - and that is "Life".

Whatever stage of life we are in, in time we will face the day when the heart stops.

Love your family, partner and friends...🙏treat them well, don't cheat them, never be dishonest or treacherous.

As we grow older and wiser, we slowly realize that wearing a watch costing Rs 300 or Rs 3000 or Rs 2- 4 lakh - all tells the same time.

Whether we have a wallet of 100 or 500 - everything inside is the same.

Whether we drive a car worth 5Lacks or a car worth 50Lacks. The path and the distance are the same and we reach the same destination.

Whether we live in a house of 300 square feet or 3000 square feet - loneliness is the same everywhere.

You will realize that your true inner happiness does not come from the material things of this world.

Whether you fly in first class or economy class, if the plane goes down, you are going to go down with it.

That's why.. I hope you realize, you have friends, brothers and sisters, with whom you chat, laugh, sing, share pleasantries,.... That's true happiness. !!

An indisputable fact of life:

Don't educate your children just to be rich. Teach them to be happy. When they grow up, they will know the value of things and not the cost.

Ami Ajalons Worte spiegeln die tiefe Überzeugung wider, dass die Verantwortung füreinander im Judentum zentral ist – eine Verantwortung, die sich besonders in der Forderung nach der Befreiung der Geiseln zeigt.

Zum ersten Mal jährt sich heute der Überfall der radikal-islamistischen Hamas auf Israel am 7. Oktober 2023, bei dem mehr als 1.200 Menschen ermordet und etwa 240 Männer, Frauen und Kinder in den Gazastreifen verschleppt wurden. Noch immer werden 101 Geiseln von der Hamas gefangengehalten.

Auf die Frage, ob er an die Rückkehr der Geiseln glaubt, antwortet Ami Ajalon, ehemaliger israelischer Geheimdienstchef, in einem aktuellen Interview mit dem Tagesspiegel:

„Ich kämpfe dafür und spreche auf allen unseren Demonstrationen darüber. Die Befreiung der Geiseln ist unsere erste Pflicht. Doch die Regierung hat sie im Stich gelassen. Der Staat wurde geschaffen, um seine Bürger zu schützen. Wenn unsere Regierung sie nicht zurückbringt, dann verdient sie es nicht, an der Macht zu sein.“

Der Wunsch nach ihrer sicheren Rückkehr und einem Abkommen zur Geiselfreilassung bleibt laut.

FIFA has launched an investigation into allegations of discrimination by Israel against Palestine, following a request from the Palestinian soccer federation. The probe, led by FIFA's Disciplinary Committee, will examine claims that Israel's soccer body illegally incorporated teams from West Bank settlements into its leagues, violating international law. This decision marks a compromise, stopping short of suspending the Israeli soccer federation outright. FIFA President Gianni Infantino ensured due diligence and followed expert advice. The investigation's timeline remains undisclosed, but it addresses the long-standing concerns of the Palestinian soccer federation.

🇺🇸🇺🇦Donald Trump said the war in Ukraine would be “resolved very quickly” if he won the US election as he met Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday (September 27), and touted his “very good relationship” with both the Ukrainian leader and Vladimir Putin, Russia’s president. 

The meeting between Trump and Zelenskyy had been in question throughout the week, with the former US president criticising the Ukrainian president for “refusing” to make a deal with Putin and members of the Republican party accusing him of siding with Kamala Harris in the race for the White House. 

While the meeting was a sign that they are searching for a common understanding of how relations between Washington and Kyiv might change in a second Trump presidency, the former president renewed his push for peace talks with Russia.

Ukrainian and many western officials have rejected the proposal as premature, saying negotiations would cement Russia’s control of big chunks of the country’s territory. 

“We have a very good relationship,” Trump told Zelenskyy as they jointly spoke to reporters before their meeting. “I also have a very good relationship, as you know, with President Putin . . . if we win I think we’re going to get it resolved very quickly.”

In a sign of the testiness around the gathering, Zelenskyy quickly interjected to say he hoped Trump would have “more good” relations with him compared with Putin. Trump responded: “You know, it takes two to tango.” 

In a brief interview with Fox News after the meeting, Trump repeated that he would broker a “fair and rapid deal” to end the war. “It has to be fair,” he said. He also called the conflict “a very complicated puzzle”.

ℹ️ Financial Times

📌 The Ukrainian military used a US-supplied long-range Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) to strike a Russian radar station, targeting the Nebo-M radar system. This strike aimed to reduce Moscow’s ability to detect and intercept aerodynamic and ballistic targets. Russia is believed to have only 10 operational Nebo-M radar systems remaining, each costing over $100 million. The Nebo-M is considered a sophisticated radar system that can detect targets at a distance of 1,000 kilometers.

Mohammed clutches his two-year-old son Ahmed in the port city Aden, Yemen. Displaced from their home in Hudaydah in 2017, Mohammed longs for the life he left behind.

"I miss my family, friends, work and our home in Hudaydah,” Mohammed said.

Yemen has been stuck in civil war for nine years now, plunging the nation into one of the world’s worst humanitarian crises. Families like Mohammed's struggle against high food prices, a failing healthcare system and relentless economic insecurity.

UNHCR is on the ground, tirelessly working to support displaced people in Yemen by providing emergency shelter, blankets, mattresses and protection services, so they can live safely despite their situation.

Photo: © UNHCR/Shadi Abusneida

The situation in yemen
#yemencrisis #yemencivilwar #saveyemen #stopthewar #helpme

Four facts about what is happening in Yemen: 

1. More than 24 million Yemenis, including 12 million children, are in urgent need of humanitarian assistance, facing severe food insecurity and malnutrition, with over 2.3 million children under the age of five suffering from acute malnutrition.

2. The conflict has led to the displacement of over 4 million people within Yemen, while nearly 300,000 Yemenis have sought refuge in neighboring countries, compounding the humanitarian crisis.

3. Access to healthcare has been severely disrupted, with over 20.5 million Yemenis lacking adequate access to healthcare services, leaving children particularly vulnerable to deadly diseases such as cholera, malaria, and diphtheria.

4. Approximately 3.7 million Yemeni children are out of school due to the conflict, with over 2,500 schools damaged or destroyed, denying children their right to education and leaving them more susceptible to exploitation and recruitment by armed groups.

Amal Hussain (7) 

{2011- October 26th, 2018} 

Amal died from severe malnutrition three years after her family escaped their home due to Saudi air strikes.

Amal had become a symbol of the civil war and subsequent famine when her photo, which was taken at a UNICEF clinic, was broadcast around the world, and just a week later she died from starvation and malnutrition at a refugee camp. At the UNICEF-run hospital Amal was vomiting and suffered from diarrhoea while doctors gave her milk every two hours.  Her mother was also reportedly ill with dengue fever spread by mosquitoes in the camp’s stagnant water. 

Due to the ongoing war approximately 7 million children are facing famine due to a severe lack of food and resources, and approximately 1.8 million under the age of five were facing acute malnutrition, with 400,000 currently suffering from acute malnutrition as of 2018. 

Since 2016, a food insecurity crisis has been ongoing in Yemen which began during the Yemeni Civil War. The UN estimates that the war has caused an estimated 130,000 deaths from indirect causes which include lack of food, health services, and infrastructure as of December 2020.

In 2018, Save the Children estimated that 85,000 children have died due to famine in the three years prior. In May 2020, UNICEF described Yemen as “the largest humanitarian crisis in the world”, and estimated that 80% of the population, over 24 million people, were in need of humanitarian assistance. In September 2022, the World Food Programme estimated that 17.4 million Yemenis struggled with food insecurity, and projected that number would increase to 19 million by the end of the year, describing this level of hunger as “unprecedented.” The crisis is being compounded by an outbreak of cholera, which resulted in over 3000 deaths between 2015 and mid 2017.

Civil wars are intricate conflicts stemming from a myriad of factors, and while national politicians can influence their trajectory, attributing them solely to political failure oversimplifies the issue. Historical, social, and economic dynamics often contribute significantly. Ethnic and cultural divides, exemplified by the Hutu-Tutsi tensions in the Rwandan Civil War, showcase how deep-seated divisions can erupt into conflict. The economic dimension is evident in disparities like those in Sudan, where resource distribution played a role in the North-South conflict. Historical grievances, as seen in the Balkans, where unresolved tensions from previous conflicts fueled the breakup of Yugoslavia, emphasize the lasting impact of history on civil unrest. Weak institutions, exemplified by corruption and instability in countries like Somalia, contribute to an environment conducive to conflict. Political instability, demonstrated by the frequent changes in leadership in Afghanistan, has hindered the establishment of a stable government. However, attributing civil wars solely to national politicians neglects the broader context. The Lebanese Civil War, for instance, involved regional and international actors contributing to the complexity. Addressing civil wars requires recognizing and addressing these multifaceted issues. It involves not only the actions of national politicians but also the engagement of international actors, local communities, civil society, and regional organizations in a comprehensive approach to conflict prevention and resolution. The responsibility extends beyond individual politicians to encompass the collective efforts of diverse stakeholders in fostering lasting peace.

The US Army’s Universal Camouflage pattern. A design created with the high hopes that it would be effective in virtually every environment but ended up working in nearly none. Though it was a controversial and almost universally unliked pattern it did manage to find its way out of the US Army and into the hands of many other forces from numerous countries around the world, some of which are seen here. Be it correctional officers in the US, The Bulgarian Air Force, officers of the Houthis aligned Air Force in Yemen and many members of Iran’s Basij this universal pattern has certainly gone global. To learn more about these design, how they’re used and what changes were done be sure to check out the full video, link to the YouTube channel can be found in the bio!

Mohammed clutches his two-year-old son Ahmed in the port city Aden, Yemen. Displaced from their home in Hudaydah in 2017, Mohammed longs for the life he left behind.

"I miss my family, friends, work and our home in Hudaydah,” Mohammed said.

Yemen has been stuck in civil war for nine years now, plunging the nation into one of the world’s worst humanitarian crises. Families like Mohammed's struggle against high food prices, a failing healthcare system and relentless economic insecurity.

UNHCR is on the ground, tirelessly working to support displaced people in Yemen by providing emergency shelter, blankets, mattresses and protection services, so they can live safely despite their situation.

Photo: © UNHCR/Shadi Abusneida

”Israel-Palestina på svensk tv 1958–1989” låter som titeln på en svensk C-uppsats. Egentligen borde den heta ”Så framställdes Israel och Palestinakonflikten på Sveriges television mellan 1959–1989”. Å andra sidan säger det kanske sig självt, det fanns bara public service mellan dessa årtal. Och SVT rapporterade duktigt nerifrån Mellanöstern. 

Ska man säga något om dokumentärerna är att den ger en fördjupad bild av både Israel och Palestinas historia. Här får man så att säga veta varför det blev som det blev, från ax till limpa. Historien berättas genom en mängd inslag och reportage som kort presenteras av med årtal, namn och reporter av Fatima Varhos. Kanske att man önskar att dokumentärserien skulle lånat lite från serien” Världens konflikter” (2008-) där en speaker fyllde i vissa skeenden. För man låter verkligen materialet tala för sig själv på alla de sätt och har man ingen förförståelse blir det svårare att hänga med. 

Man menar också att arkivmaterial säger ganska lite av vad som verkligen skett men mycket om hur det framställdes. Ett ganska märkligt påstående, materialet visar väl vad som hände? Hur det framställdes finns det säkerligen forskning om bland mediestudier, om man vill djupdyka. Däremot kan det tänkas att regissören Göran Hugo Olsson själv gjort ett urval där han berättar en version av många. Och det sägs egentligen ingenting om hur SVT framställde konflikten. Det blir en linjär berättelse som berättar om de stora händelserna, kriget, folkets lidande på båda sidor, hopp om fred och så vidare.

 Men ”Israel-Palestina på svensk tv 1958–1989” är ändock brännande aktuell och visar verkligen på hur komplex denna konflikt är.
Regissör: Göran Hugo Olsson

RIUNIFICAZIONE DELLO YEMEN

Il 22 maggio 1990 le due repubbliche yemenite, la Repubblica Araba dello Yemen (Yemen del Nord), di matrice repubblicano-autoritario, e la Repubblica Democratica dello Yemen (Yemen del Sud), ideologicamente marxista/arabo socialista, si unirono per formare la Repubblica dello Yemen.

Dopo anni di scontri e lunghi negoziati, i due governi raggiunsero un accordo per unire il Paese sotto un'unica amministrazione: Ali Abdullah Saleh venne nominato Capo di Stato e Ali Salim al-Beidh divenne Capo del Governo. L’unificazione venne confermata da un referendum nel 1991.

La riunificazione dello Yemen ha rappresentato un momento di grande speranza e ottimismo per il popolo yemenita, oltre che per la pace nella regione. Si sperava infatti che la fusione delle due repubbliche potesse portare a un periodo di stabilità politica, sviluppo economico e progresso sociale per tutto il paese.

Tuttavia, la riunificazione non è stata priva di sfide e difficoltà. Le differenze politiche, economiche e culturali tra il Nord e il Sud hanno creato tensioni e divisioni. Inoltre, le disparità socio-economiche e le questioni territoriali hanno contribuito ad alimentare il malcontento e le tensioni interne.

Nel corso degli anni successivi alla riunificazione, lo Yemen ha affrontato una serie di problemi, come corruzione, instabilità politica e insicurezza economica. Già nel 1993 scoppiò una prima guerra civile, quando i sudisti del Partito Socialista Yemenita secederono per dare vita alla Repubblica Democratica dello Yemen - di nuovo. 

A questa situazione continua di scontro si aggiunsero le mire autoritarie di Saleh e la conseguente guerra civile del 2014: lo scoppio del conflitto tra il governo yemenita e i ribelli Houthi ha ulteriormente complicato la situazione nel Paese, portando a una guerra civile che ha causato una grave crisi umanitaria.

La situazione in Yemen rimane tuttora complessa e instabile, con conseguenze devastanti per la popolazione. La guerra ha causato un'enorme sofferenza umana, con milioni di persone che sono state costrette a lasciare le proprie case, affrontando la fame, la malnutrizione e la mancanza di assistenza medica adeguata.

The Israeli army acknowledged yesterday that Iran's Tuesday night missile attack on the occupied state damaged some of its air bases, but it said the damage was minimal.

According to the military, as was cited by Army Radio, the strikes only caused damage to office buildings and other maintenance facilities on the sites, not harming the Israeli Air Force's ability to carry out its duties. They did not target aircraft, weaponry, or critical operational equipment.

"All of the missile impacts in the air bases are deemed by the military as 'ineffective,' meaning that no harm was caused to the continuous operations of the air force," the army stated in a statement. "No air force aircraft were damaged in the attack."

(ANI) ;इजराइल ने संयुक्त राष्ट्र महासचिव एंटोनियो गुटेरेस को इजराइल में अवांछित घोषित कर दिया है 

और उनके देश में प्रवेश पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया है। इजराइल के विदेश मंत्री, इजराइल काट्ज़ ने ट्वीट किया, "आज, मैंने संयुक्त राष्ट्र महासचिव एंटोनियो गुटेरेस को इजराइल में अवांछित घोषित कर दिया है 

और उनके देश में प्रवेश पर प्रतिबंध लगा दिया है। जो कोई भी इजराइल पर ईरान के जघन्य हमले की स्पष्ट रूप से निंदा नहीं कर सकता है, 

जैसा कि दुनिया के लगभग हर देश ने किया है, वह इजराइल की धरती पर कदम रखने के लायक नहीं है। 

यह एक ऐसा महासचिव है जिसने अभी तक 7 अक्टूबर को हमास के हत्यारों द्वारा किए गए नरसंहार और यौन अत्याचारों की निंदा नहीं की है, न ही उन्होंने उन्हें आतंकवादी संगठन घोषित करने के किसी प्रयास का नेतृत्व किया है।

 एक महासचिव जो हमास, हिजबुल्लाह, हौथिस और अब ईरान - वैश्विक आतंक की जननी - के आतंकवादियों, बलात्कारियों और हत्यारों का समर्थन करता है,

 उसे संयुक्त राष्ट्र के इतिहास पर एक दाग के रूप में याद किया जाएगा। इजराइल अपने नागरिकों की रक्षा करना और अपनी राष्ट्रीय गरिमा को बनाए रखना जारी रखेगा, चाहे एंटोनियो गुटेरेस हों या न हों।"

According to UNICEF, since the civil war in Yemen began 8 years ago, over 11,000 children have been killed or injured. “Thousands of children have lost their lives, hundreds of thousands more remain at risk of death from preventable disease or starvation,” said UNICEF executive director Catherine Russell. Meanwhile about 2.2 million Yemeni children are acutely malnourished. All players in the Yemen conflict are responsible for the deaths of these innocent children.⁠

The Houthis have a complex relationship with Yemen's Sunni Muslims; the movement has discriminated against Sunnis, but also recruited and allied with them.Under the leadership of Hussein Badreddin al-Houthi, the group emerged as an opposition to former Yemeni president Ali Abdullah Saleh. They accused him of corruption and criticized him for being backed by Saudi Arabia and the United States. Hussein accused Saleh of seeking to please the U.S. at the expense of the Yemeni people and Yemen's sovereignty.

Resisting Saleh's order for his arrest, Hussein was killed in Sa'dah in 2004 along with a number of his guards by the Yemeni army, sparking the Houthi insurgency in Yemen

Yemeni Civil War (North Yemen)

1st ➡️ 4th : Yemen Arab Republic
الجمهورية العربية اليمنية

Date : 1962–1990
Government : Unitary one-party republic under a military junta

known simply as North Yemen or Yemen (Sanaʽa), was a country from 1962 to 1990 in the northwestern part of what is now Yemen.Its capital was at Sanaa. It united with the People's Democratic Republic of Yemen (commonly known as South Yemen) on 22 May 1990 to form the current Republic of Yemen

5th ➡️ 10th : Pro-Hadi/Alimi 
Yemen National Army (YNA)
Al-Islah
Popular Resistance Committees
Popular Committees Strategic Reserve (pro-Hadi-Saleh forces)

The Presidential Leadership Council (Arabic: مجلس القيادة الرئاسي) is the executive body of Yemen's internationally-recognized government, formed in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, by a presidential decree on 7 April 2022, to seek a "comprehensive political solution" to the Yemeni civil war. It is headed by Rashad Muhammad Al-Alimi and has a membership of eight members.All the powers of the president and vice president have been transferred to this council.

Yemeni Civil War (South Yemen)

People's Democratic Republic of Yemen
جمهورية اليمن الديمقراطية الشعبية

Independence declared : 30 November 1967
UN membership : 14 December 1967
Constitution adopted : 31 October 1978
Unification : 22 May 1990

Government : Unitary Marxist–Leninist
one-party socialist republic

South Yemen's origins can be traced to 1874 with the creation of the British Colony of Aden and the Aden Protectorate, which consisted of two-thirds of the present-day Yemen. Prior to 1937 what was to become the Colony of Aden had been governed as a part of British India, originally as the Aden Settlement subordinate to the Bombay Presidency and then as a Chief Commissioner's province. After the collapse of Aden Protectorate, a state of emergency was declared in 1963, when the National Liberation Front (NLF) and the Front for the Liberation of Occupied South Yemen (FLOSY) rebelled against the British rule.

The Federation of South Arabia and the Protectorate of South Arabia merged to become the People's Republic of Yemen on 30 November 1967, which later changed its name to the People's Democratic Republic of Yemen. It became a Marxist–Leninist one-party state in 1969 and was supported by Cuba, East Germany and the Soviet Union. It was the only communist state to be established in the Arab world

Despite its efforts to bring stability into the region, it was involved in a brief civil war in 1986. Following the collapse of the USSR, South Yemen was unified with the Yemen Arab Republic, commonly known as "North Yemen", on 22 May 1990 to form the present-day Republic of Yemen. After three years, however, a political crisis arose between the South's YSP and the North's GPC and Islah parties after the parliamentary elections in 1993. South Yemen declared its secession from the North Yemen in 1994 as the Democratic Republic of Yemen. This effort ended after North Yemen occupied the area as a result of the 1994 civil war. Another attempt to restore South Yemen as a nation, with the Southern Transitional Council as its new government, began in 2017 as part of the 2014 Yemeni Civil War.

Yemeni Civil War (2010s ~ Ongoing) Part Xlll
Date : 16 September 2014 (Begin)

The Casualities of War

💀 377,000+ people killed overall (150,000+ from violence) (2014–2021) (UN)

💀 85,000 Yemeni children died from starvation (2015–2018) (Save the Children)

💀 ~4,000 dead from cholera epidemic; 2.5+ million cases overall (2016–2021)

💀 4 million people cumulatively displaced (2015–2020) (UNHCR)

💀500+ killed in Saudi Arabia by Houthi attacks (2014–2016) (Saudi Arabia figure)

🇦🇪 3 Emirati civilians killed

CNN reported on 8 April 2015 that almost 10,160,000 Yemenis were deprived of water, food, and electricity as a result of the conflict. The report also added per source from UNICEF officials in Yemen that within 15 days, some 100,000 people across the country were dislocated, while Oxfam said that more than 10 million Yemenis did not have enough food to eat, in addition to 850,000 half-starved children. Over 13 million civilians were without access to clean water

💀 War crime accusations

According to Farea Al-Muslim, direct war crimes have been committed during the conflict; for example, an IDP camp was hit by a Saudi airstrike, while Houthis have sometimes prevented aid workers from giving aid.

The UN and several major human rights groups discussed the possibility that war crimes may have been committed by Saudi Arabia during the air campaign

British researcher Alex de Waal wrote that the "responsibility for Yemen goes beyond Riyadh and Abu Dhabi to London and Washington. Britain has sold at least £4.5 billion in arms to Saudi Arabia and £500 million to the UAE since the war began. The US role is even bigger: Trump authorized arms sales to the Saudis worth $110 billion last May. Yemen will be the defining famine crime of this generation, perhaps this century."

During the discussions, EU sanctions envoy David O'Sullivan emphasized the need for relentless enforcement of the price cap, which currently prevents access to Western shipping services for Russian oil sold above $60 per barrel. However, the measure's impact has diminished as Russia has built up a fleet of aging tankers to bypass sanctions, raising concerns about safety and environmental risks. The EU Commission highlighted that Russia is spending nearly half of its federal budget on defense and security, with increased costs for crucial imports like semiconductors and machine tools, largely sourced through Turkey and China. O'Sullivan noted the EU's plans to target specific financial institutions and scrutinize product transit from Southeast Asia through China that supports Russia’s military efforts. Ukraine’s presidential adviser flagged China as a key issue, reflecting growing international concerns about Beijing’s role in the conflict. The meeting underscored the importance of coordinated action and stricter enforcement to close loopholes and apply pressure on Moscow.

There is considerable acrimony and ire in Russia over Indian-origin artillery ammunition being used in Ukraine. Photographs of both Indian-origin and Pakistani-origin artillery/mortar ammunition have been appearing on social media over the past several months. Moscow has reportedly raised this issue at least on two occasions, including in July 2024 during a meeting between the Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar. This indicates a diplomatic strain as Russia seeks to address its concerns regarding the supply of Indian-made 155mm artillery shells to Ukraine.

Now ‘Reuters’ has published a report, citing two Indian government and two India’s defence industry sources (all unnamed), saying that India produced only a very small amount of the ammunition being used by Ukraine; one official estimating that it was under 1% of the total arms imported by Kyiv since the war. Adding spice to the narrative, Walter Ladwig of King’s College London, said the diversion of a relatively small amount of ammunition was geopolitically useful for Delhi since it allows India to show partners in the West that it is not ‘on Russia’s side’ in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.”

Calling the Reuters report “inaccurate, misleading, speculative and mischievous”, Randhir Jaiswal, spokesperson for the Ministry of External Affairs, has said, “It implies violations by India where none exist and, hence, is inaccurate and mischievous.

Ad agosto 2022 sono tornato in #Yemen.

Marib rimane ad oggi il luogo più sicuro per milioni di sfollati che hanno lasciato le terre di conflitto da tutto il paese. In cerca di rifugio politico e umanitario.
La città sta affrontando una crescita senza precedenti, fino al 2015 era una piccola città di quasi 400.000 abitanti, controllata da tribù locali. Oggi conta quasi 3 milioni di abitanti, attrae investimenti da tutto il paese e resta l'unico luogo dello Yemen dove c'è libertà di espressione, grazie ad una politica aperta del governatore Sultan al Arada. 
Marib era un tempo la capitale dell'antico regno della Regina di Saba, le cui rovine ancora vengono visitate dalle famiglie locali. Le recenti situazioni politiche dello Yemen stanno portando Marib a diventare una delle città più sviluppate del paese.
Le famiglie approfittano del cessate il fuoco tra le forze Houthi e quelle della coalizione per tornare ad affollare i luoghi di aggregazione. 
Nonostante la linea del fronte a pochi kilometri dal centro cittadino, Marib cerca di tornare a vivere.

Yemen's Forgotten War

On this day in 2014, Houthi rebel forces expanded their territorial control in Yemen, sparking the official start of the Civil War in 2015.

Catalina Martin-Chico is one of the few photographers who has worked in Yemen on a regular basis during the last decade. Her 2016 collection of photographs focuses on the effects of conflict on local inhabitants.

Despite the present ceasefire, the conflict shows no prospects of conclusion after 8 years.

Yemen is the poorest country in the Arab world, and the civil war has gone virtually unnoticed by the major Western press, despite the horrific conditions in which the Yemeni people live.

For much of the war, the country has been divided between the Houthis and their allies, based in the North, and the internationally recognised government in Aden, supported by Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Sudan, Morocco and Senegal. 

Saudi Arabia alleges that the Houthis are receiving arms and training from it's arch rival Iran, a fact that has widened the conflict significantly and tied it into the broader regional conflict that is playing out from Syria and Lebanon to Iraq and other parts of the gulf. 

Since the beginning of 2015, Saudi and allied planes have been bombarding strategic targets to deprive the Houthis of infrastructure to continue the war. As so often in modern warfare, however, it's the civilian population that bears the brunt of the suffering.

Supply routes and agricultural output have entirely broken down as a result of the war. Famine has been ravaging the country's population since 2016, compounding the already terrible effects of the Civil War. An estimated 24 million people (80% of the population) require humanitarian assistance. In addition to soaring food prices, 3 million people have been forced to flee their homes.

See more: https://library.panos.co.uk/features/stories/yemen-s-forgotten-war.html

As #ukraine bleeds we forget the horror of #yemen ‘forgotten war’ or a war which is still going on!!
According to Stephen O’Brien, the United Nations humanitarian affairs coordinator, the level of disregard for human life and the resulting suffering in that country is nearly incomprehensible. Furthermore, parties involved in the conflict are accused of violating both international human rights law and international humanitarian law to the extent that it should “shock the conscience of humanity”. 

Since the start of the war in Yemen in 2015, 111 000 people have lost their lives, and since the beginning of 2022 one person has died or has been injured every hour. These figures are expected to increase in the foreseeable future. Moreover, thousands of airstrikes have resulted in the breakdown of medical and educational facilities, while food insecurity — which worsened as a result of the #ukrainian invasion — has affected more than 16.2 million people in Yemen, with in excess of 2.25 million children suffering from acute malnutrition. Furthermore, outbreaks of cholera and Covid-19 have worsened conditions for civilians who have already lost their access to the basic human rights of education, food, personal security and healthcare.

US Discusses Joint Response After Iran Launches Missile Barrage at Israel

The United States announced that it is in discussions over a coordinated response after Iran fired a barrage of missiles at Israel, warning Tehran of "severe consequences" for the attack. Israel, while intercepting most of the missiles, vowed to make Iran "pay" and threatened immediate, powerful retaliation across the Middle East.

The missile strikes, which occurred late Tuesday, have further escalated tensions in the already volatile region. Tehran, in a show of defiance, warned that it would target critical infrastructure across Israel if Iran's territory were attacked in response.

President Joe Biden expressed the United States' unwavering support for Israel following the missile assault. He emphasized that discussions are ongoing with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to determine a joint response to Iran’s aggressive actions.

When pressed by reporters about potential US actions towards Iran, Biden stated, "That's in active discussion right now," signaling that a formal response could be imminent.

The escalating rhetoric and military actions have raised concerns about further conflict in the Middle East, as both nations stand firm in their retaliatory threats.

The Iran-Israel conflict is a complex and multifaceted issue that has been ongoing for decades. At its core, it's a proxy conflict between Iran and Israel, with Iran supporting Lebanese Shia militias, such as Hezbollah, and Palestinian groups like Hamas, while Israel supports Iranian rebels and conducts airstrikes against Iranian allies in Syria.

*Historical Context*

The conflict has its roots in the 1960s and 1970s, when Iranian Islamists, including Ayatollah Mahmoud Taleghani and Ruhollah Khomeini, began sympathizing with the Palestinian people and criticizing Israel's existence. Following the 1979 Iranian Revolution, Iran's new government adopted a policy of hostility towards Israel, severing diplomatic ties and referring to Israel as the "Zionist regime".

*Key Issues*

Several factors contribute to the ongoing tensions:

- Palestinian Support: Iran sees itself as a champion of the Palestinian people, while Israel views Iran's involvement as an existential threat ¹.
- Nuclear Program: Israel is concerned about Iran's nuclear ambitions, and has conducted airstrikes and assassinations to hinder its progress ¹.
- Regional Influence: Iran seeks to expand its influence in the Middle East, while Israel aims to limit its reach ¹.

*Recent Developments*

The conflict has escalated in recent years, with increased military clashes and proxy wars in Syria, Lebanon, and Gaza. The 2024 Iran-Israel conflict has seen significant exchanges of fire, including Iranian strikes against Israel and Israeli airstrikes on Iranian targets.

*International Response*

The international community has called for restraint and diplomacy, with some countries, like Russia, attempting to broker peace talks. However, a lasting resolution remains elusive, and the conflict continues to simmer.

🇪🇺🇺🇦The European Union pledged on Friday (September 20) to lend Ukraine up to 35 billion euros ($39 billion) as part of a loan package organized by the Group of Seven major industrial nations, as it seeks to help the country rebuild its economy and its war-shattered power grid.

G7 leaders agreed in June to engineer a $50 billion loan to help Ukraine in its fight for survival. Interest earned on profits from Russia’s frozen central bank assets would be used as collateral, but progress in distributing the loans has been slow.

“We should make Russia pay for the destruction it caused,” European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen told reporters at a news conference in Kyiv with President Vlodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv.

Von der Leyen said that the EU has already provided Ukraine with more than 118 billion euros ($132 billion) in military and economic assistance since the war began in February 2022, “but Russia’s relentless attacks mean further support is necessary.”

The loans would be underwritten by the windfall profits earned on almost $300 billion in Russian assets, which have been frozen over its full-scale invasion of Ukraine. The vast majority of that money is held in EU nations, notably Belgium.

Von der Leyen said that the EU is “confident that we can deliver this loan to Ukraine very quickly.” The 27-nation bloc hopes that other G7 countries will follow its lead and start providing loans too.

Zelenskyy said that his priorities are to rebuild Ukraine’s energy network, erect more bomb shelters, improve schools and buy more weapons and ammunition.

ℹ️ AP News
