Russian Missiles Kill Five, Wound 41 in Ukraine's Pokrovsk

A Russian double-tap missile attack on Pokrovsk, Donetsk region, killed at least five and injured 41, including four children, as reported by Reuters.
Regional governor Vadym Filashkin called it one of the largest attacks on civilians recently. President Zelenskiy vowed a fair response. The attack damaged six cars, 16 houses, and left a massive crater. The area remains a hotspot in the ongoing conflict. #UkraineWar #PokrovskAttack #RussiaUkraineConflict #CivilianCasualties

The UAE has once again demonstrated its commitment to diplomacy and conflict resolution, successfully mediating another prisoner exchange between Russia and Ukraine. This latest swap saw the release of 180 captives - 90 from each side.

The UAE's Ministry of Foreign Affairs praised the cooperation of both Russia and Ukraine, stating that this exchange "demonstrates the country's consistent position in calling for diplomacy, dialogue and de-escalation" in the ongoing conflict.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy welcomed the return of the Ukrainian prisoners, pledging to continue efforts to bring home all those still held by Russia. This prisoner swap marks an important step forward in resolving the conflict through diplomatic means, with the UAE playing a crucial role as a neutral mediator.

#UnitedArabEmirates #RussiaUkraineConflict #PrisonerExchange #Diplomacy #Mediation @uaeembassyus @uaemedia.ae

The International Criminal Court (ICC) in The Hague has issued arrest warrants for former Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and current military Chief of the General Staff Valery Gerasimov. These charges are related to alleged crimes during Russia's invasion of Ukraine, particularly for their roles in directing missile strikes against Ukraine's electric infrastructure from October 10, 2022, to March 9, 2023. The court believes there are reasonable grounds to hold Shoigu and Gerasimov responsible for these actions, categorizing them as war crimes and crimes against humanity due to the targeting of civilians and civilian objects.

These charges add to the broader context of ICC actions against Russian officials, including President Vladimir Putin, who is already facing an ICC arrest warrant for the alleged forced relocation of Ukrainian children to Russia. Despite these charges, Russia, not being a full signatory to the ICC, typically does not extradite its citizens, raising doubts about whether Shoigu and Gerasimov will ever stand trial. Shoigu, who was recently dismissed from his role and reassigned to Russia's security council, and Gerasimov were among Putin's most senior defence officials, highlighting the high-level nature of these accusations.
Source: Reuters, AP

So what
While no doubt justified it is unlikely this move will do anything more than aggravate the Kremlin and restrict any movement by the two generals (something that was already highly unlikely). Additionally, this puts an end to rumours that Shoigu may defect following his removal as it is highly unlikely he would willing to go to a country that may end up selling him out to the ICC.

La donna ritratta in questi scatti è Olga Ivanovna Kulygina, durante la secessione della Repubblica di Donetsk. Olga era un agente russo, che dava supporto e svolgeva ruoli di comando durante le rivolte filo russe nel Donbass. Aveva combattuto nella guerra fra Transnistria e Moldavia 1992, ufficialmente svolgendo il ruolo di medico, in realtà ha condotto molte azioni di sabotaggio. Prima delle rivolte del 2014 Olga si trovava da alcuni anni in Ucraina, Slovyansk, ufficialmente come insegnante di management. Olga fu catturata circa un mese dopo queste immagini mentre trasportava un carico d'armi e denaro dalla Russia nel Donbass. Fu scambiata con 17 prigionieri ucraini. Attualmente è ancora sul fronte ma ufficialmente svolge sempre la professione di medico.

The United Nations has reported that Israel has denied access to Gaza for about one-third of all aid missions since the beginning of this month, contributing to "a continued cycle of deprivation and distress" for the population in the war-torn Palestinian territory.

According to the latest situation report from the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), 198 people were killed and 430 injured in Israeli attacks between Friday and Monday.

From August 1 to 11, Israeli authorities denied access to northern Gaza for 32 of 85 coordinated humanitarian aid missions. An additional 13 missions were impeded by Israeli authorities, and six were canceled due to logistical and security reasons, according to the OCHA report.

#GazaCrisis #HumanitarianAid #UNReport #Palestine #IsraelPalestineConflict #smartnewspk #smartnews

“As Jewish survivors and descendants of survivors and victims of the Nazi genocide we unequivocally condemn the massacre of Palestinians in Gaza and the ongoing occupation and colonization of historic Palestine. We further condemn the United States for providing Israel with the funding to carry out the attack, and Western states more generally for using their diplomatic muscle to protect Israel from condemnation. Genocide begins with the silence of the world.

“We are alarmed by the extreme, racist dehumanization of Palestinians in Israeli society, which has reached a fever-pitch. In Israel, politicians and pundits in The Times of Israel and The Jerusalem Post have called openly for genocide of Palestinians and right-wing Israelis are adopting Neo-Nazi insignia.

“Furthermore, we are disgusted and outraged by Elie Wiesel’s abuse of our history in these pages to justify the unjustifiable: Israel’s wholesale effort to destroy Gaza and the murder of more than 2,000 Palestinians, including many hundreds of children. Nothing can justify bombing UN shelters, homes, hospitals and universities. Nothing can justify depriving people of electricity and water.

“We must raise our collective voices and use our collective power to bring about an end to all forms of racism, including the ongoing genocide of Palestinian people. We call for an immediate end to the siege against and blockade of Gaza. We call for the full economic, cultural and academic boycott of Israel. “Never again” must mean NEVER AGAIN FOR ANYONE!”
--Hajo Meyer, Holocaust survivor

🚨 🇦🇫 Islamic Emirate condemns Israeli attack on school in Gaza

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan has condemned the "brutal" Israeli attack on a Palestinian school in al-Darj in the center of the Gaza Strip, which killed more than 100 people and wounded dozens more. .

The Foreign Ministry issued a statement on Sunday condemning the attack and calling for regional and international action against the Israeli regime to stop the genocide of the Palestinians.

Ajit Doval, India's National Security Advisor, is in Russia attending the BRICS National Security Advisers' Meeting in Moscow. Alongside this, Doval is engaging in high-level discussions with President Putin to explore peace efforts aimed at resolving the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.
This visit is part of India's broader diplomatic engagements, including PM Modi's recent visits to both Russia and Ukraine, emphasizing India's role as a mediator for dialogue and peace. 🇮🇳🤝🇷🇺🇺🇦

After winning the Gold medal at the Paris Olympics, Arshad Nadeem received pledges worth crores along with gifts such as cars and apartments/ plots.

According to reports, the FBR has set its sights on his prize money and gifts. If Arshad is a filer, he will need to pay a 15% tax, amounting to Rs 3 crore, assuming the total value of his gifts and prize money is Rs 20 crore.

However, if Arshad is a non-filer, he will be liable to pay 30% in taxes, which would amount to Rs 6 crore on the pledged amount and gifts.

What Happened: Since October 7, over 40,000 Palestinians have reportedly been killed in Israeli attacks, according to Gaza’s Health Ministry. The situation remains dire, with many more people trapped under rubble and facing severe health risks. The humanitarian crisis has prompted urgent calls for a ceasefire.

What You Need to Know: The US and Israel have sent delegations to Qatar for renewed ceasefire talks, which resumed today. Hamas has expressed a willingness to meet with mediators after these discussions to assess whether Israel is genuinely committed to the proposed truce terms.

More: Jewish Voice for Peace, a US-based advocacy group, has reported that Israel has dropped more than 70,000 bombs on Gaza since October 7, based on UN satellite data. This significant escalation underscores the intensity of the conflict and the urgent need for a resolution to alleviate the suffering in Gaza.

▶️ गाजा के दाराज जिले में शनिवार सुबह एक स्कूल पर इजरायली हमले में 100 से ज्यादा लोग मारे गए, जिनमें महिलाएं, बच्चे और बुजुर्ग शामिल हैं। अलजजीरा की रिपोर्ट के अनुसार, यह हमला उस वक्त हुआ जब कई शरणार्थी सुबह की नमाज पढ़ रहे थे।

▶️ स्थानीय लोगों का कहना है कि तीन रॉकेट लगातार स्कूल पर गिरे, जिससे वहां आग लग गई और कई लोग मलबे में दब गए। इजरायली सेना का दावा है कि अल-तबीन स्कूल का इस्तेमाल हमास के आतंकियों द्वारा किया जा रहा था और यह हमला आम नागरिकों पर नहीं बल्कि आतंकियों पर किया गया था।

▶️ हालांकि, इस घटना में बड़ी संख्या में निर्दोष लोगों की जान चली गई, जिससे इलाके में दहशत और गुस्से का माहौल है।

On March 10, 2023, ten U.S.-based Christian groups published a letter directed to President Biden and Congress calling on the end of U.S. military aid to Israel. 

The letter reads: “In response to our Christian call to be peacemakers, we work with Palestinian and Israeli partners who live there as they struggle to realize a just and lasting peace. Memories of the good old days)
- I constantly work on being a better person each and every day. I analyze past mistakes and poor decisions made in order not to repeat them and to become the best version of myself possible. Life is to short to carry so much hate or resentment towards a specific group of people or society. One day we will all eventually face death and we won’t have the ability to change what it isn’t we aren’t proud of or what aspirations and opportunities we missed. That’s why it’s so important to enjoy the now and to appreciate all the gifts and relationships that life sends our way. Being a soldier means you place the welfare, safety, and freedoms of those you protect and serve. Society and life as we know it only exists  because of the selfless service and sacrifices of our men and women made defending it.

A drone attack early this morning caused several oil storage tanks to catch fire near the town of Azov in Russia's southern Rostov region, which borders Ukraine. The governor of the Rostov region, Vasily Golubev, reported the incident on the Telegram messaging app, stating that oil product tanks were set ablaze due to the drone strike and that, according to preliminary data, there were no casualties. The Russian Emergencies Ministry released videos showing thick smoke and large flames emanating from the affected oil storage tanks. In response to the fire, approximately 200 firefighters and emergency personnel were deployed to the site to combat the blaze.

While Ukraine did not immediately claim responsibility for the attack, it has a history of conducting similar strikes. Kyiv has justified these actions by stating that such targets are legitimate, as they are used to fuel Russia's military operations during its invasion of Ukraine. The ongoing conflict has seen frequent use of drone technology to target infrastructure critical to the opposing side's military capabilities. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions and active conflict between Russia and Ukraine, with both sides engaging in strategic strikes aimed at crippling each other's resources and military supply chains. The situation remains tense, with international observers closely monitoring the developments.
Source: Reuters, DW, EuroNews

So what
It is highly likely Kyiv is using these attacks as a way to slowly degrade Russia's ability to trade oil, thereby significantly damaging its money-making ability and directly hurting its war effort. This is due to the likelihood that the country's leadership understands that the West and other countries cannot or will not stop buying Russian oil, regardless of the situation, so their only remaining choice is to conduct attacks on this infrastructure directly. So far, this appears to be an effective strategy with Russian oil exports already falling dramatically.

India on Sunday opted out of the Ukraine declaration adopted at the two-day Summit on #Peace in Ukraine, averring that only options acceptable to both parties can bring about abiding peace.

India, along with other #BRICS nations, decided not to join more than 70 other countries in supporting a resolution that characterises the ongoing conflict as a “war of the Russian Federation against Ukraine”.

Presenting India’s position, Pavan Kapoor, the secretary (West) in the external affairs ministry, said: “In our view, only those options acceptable to both parties can lead to abiding peace. In line with this approach, we have decided to avoid association with a joint communique or any other document emerging from this summit.”

According to Kapoor, India thought it important to join the gathering that seeks to explore the way forward for a negotiated settlement to a complex and pressing issue. “India shares the global concern over the situation in Ukraine and supports any collective desire to facilitate peaceful resolution of the conflict. India’s participation in the Summit on Peace in Ukraine as well as in the preceding NSA political director-level meetings based on Ukraine’s peace formula is in line with our clear and consistent approach that enduring peace can be achieved only through dialogue and diplomacy,” he said.

🇫🇷|| Al 70º aniversario de la Aviación del Ejército francés

Este año se cumple el 70º aniversario de la Aviación del Ejército de la República Francesa. Aviation légère de l'armée de Terre, ALAT, lit.  La "Aviación del Ejército Ligero" se creó como una unidad separada el 22 de noviembre de 1954, cuando, después de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, en Francia se entendió la necesidad de separar las unidades de aviación de la marina y el ejército de la Fuerza Aérea.

La creación de ALAT fue impulsada por la necesidad de aumentar la movilidad y eficacia de las fuerzas terrestres, especialmente dada la experiencia de la Segunda Guerra Mundial y las guerras en Indochina y Argelia.

Para su aniversario, ALAT presentó dos helicópteros con diseños especiales: Eurocopter Tiger y NH90 y compartió hermosas fotografías. Algunas de las fotografías (firmadas) fueron tomadas por el reconocido fotógrafo profesional de aviación Anthony Pecchi..

‼️Sanciones vanas: Rusia🇷🇺 supera a EEUU🇺🇸 en exportación de gas a Europa
.
🔺Por primera vez en dos años, las importaciones europeas de gas procedente de Rusia superaron a las de Estados Unidos.
.
Según el diario estadounidense Financial Times, las importaciones europeas de gas desde Rusia superaron en mayo a las de Estados Unidos por primera vez en dos años, a pesar de los esfuerzos de la región por deshacerse de los combustibles fósiles rusos desde la operación militar especial en Ucrania.
.
“Después de todos los esfuerzos que hemos hecho para aislar y comprometer nuestro suministro de energía, es sorprendente ver la cuota de mercado de gas y gas natural licuado (GNL) de Rusia en Europa”, declaró el director de energía de la consultora Conferencia Internacional sobre Sistemas de Información (ICIS, por sus siglas en inglés), con sede en Londres, Tom Marzec-Manser.
.
En este sentido, los informes del Financial revelaron que la situación evidencia el desafío de Europa de reducir aún más la dependencia del gas ruso, ya que varios países de Europa del Este, en particular, todavía dependen de las importaciones de sus vecinos.
.
.

Ukraine on Saturday said Russia had launched a "massive" overnight attack on energy infrastructure in the west and south, adding that at least seven people died from Moscow strikes elsewhere.

Russia launched 16 cruise missiles from land, sea and air as well as 13 attack drones, aiming at energy infrastructure in several regions, Ukraine's military said.

Air defences downed all but four of them, it added.

Russia's defence ministry said that its troops "carried out a group strike with long-range high-precision weaponry from air and sea and also drones on Ukrainian energy facilities that power arms production".

It said it also targeted warehouses containing munitions and "air-launched weapons provided to the Ukrainian military by western countries".

Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán warned against allowing Ukraine to strike Russian targets with Western weapons, stating that it could bring Europe closer to destruction. In an interview on state radio, Orbán criticized French President Emmanuel Macron for not ruling out sending troops to Ukraine and expressed concern about a NATO proposal that would provide Kyiv with advanced long-range weapons capable of hitting Russian military bases. The Hungarian leader cautioned that these actions could escalate the conflict in Ukraine into a larger global conflict.

Viktor Orbán:
“War is a monster that is constantly hungry, it must be fed, and it must be fed with money. And I see that the Americans and the Democratic government of the United States, and the leaders of the European Union, are ready to feed it,”

Russian President Vladimir Putin stated on Thursday that Moscow is ready for peace talks with Ukraine at any time and place.

Speaking at a news conference in Vietnam's capital Hanoi that was live-streamed on the Kremlin website, Putin said he expected that the West would oppose his peace initiative on Ukraine.

The Russian president questioned why Russia's proposal was called "unrealistic" while no one criticized the same way Ukraine's "ultimatum," containing conditions unacceptable for Moscow.

Sane politicians will think about Russia's proposal on Ukraine if they want to end the conflict, he said, warning that conditions may change depending on the situation on the battlefield.

YEMEN ON EDGE

🇾🇪 CONTEXT: Last week, Yemen’s Iranian-backed Houthi group targeted the United Arab Emirates via a drone strike in Abu Dhabi, killing three, injuring six and leading to massive blazes in oil tankers. 

❗️This triggered a series of air strikes on Yemen by the Saudi Arabia-led coalition, of which UAE is a part. 

🥀 Fourteen people died in an air raid on the capital, Sanaa, and at least three children were killed in an attack on the port city of Hodeida. 

🥀 On Jan 21, an airstrike on a prison in the northern city of Saada, the rebels' home base, killed at least 87 people and wounded more than 100, overwhelming hospitals—though the coalition has denied responsibility for the prison attack. (Aid agencies on the ground like Doctors Without Borders have dismissed the denial.)

👉🏽WHAT NOW: Just today, two ballistic missiles fired by the Houthis were intercepted and destroyed over Abu Dhabi.

👉🏽The Houthis have warned of further attacks, while UAE issued a statement saying it is "ready to deal with any threats".

🇷🇺❌🇺🇦 23.06.2024 Ataque da Ucrânia deixa cinco civis mortos e centenas de feridos na Crimeia 
 
A Ucrânia atacou a infraestrutura civil de Sebastopol (Crimeia) com mísseis ATACMS produzidos nos EUA e equipados com ogivas cluster, conforme afirmou o Ministério da Defesa russo. 
 
Os mísseis contra Sebastopol foram lançados pelas Forças Armadas Ucranianas da área de Nikolaev. Segundo informações da TASS (agência de notícias russa), estão em andamento trabalhos para eliminar a tripulação, conforme disse uma fonte das forças de segurança do país. 
 
A cidade portuária é alvo frequente de ataques por abrigar o quartel-general da frota russa no Mar Negro. A Crimeia é um ponto logístico fundamental para o Exército russo. 
 
Segundo o Ministério da Defesa da Rússia: "A responsabilidade do bombardeio deliberado com mísseis contra os civis em Sebastopol recai principalmente em Washington, que forneceu estas armas à Ucrânia". O dia 24 de junho foi declarado dia de luto em Sebastopol após o ataque das Forças Armadas da Ucrânia.

Russia has moved aggressively to block Ukraine’s grain exports, aiming to crush both a critical economic sector and source of national pride. But Ukrainians have found ways to keep their crucial food supplies flowing as they enter the third year of Europe’s largest war in eight decades.

As the conflict continues, Russia has targeted Ukrainian grain and port facilities with air strikes, a potential war crime. The ports supplied staple goods to people around the world and anchored Ukraine’s economy. But a Russian blockade has changed the calculus.

Naval victories and innovative export routes have allowed Ukraine to keep its grain moving. After the collapse of the Black Sea grain deal, policymakers feared prices would again soar and potentially leave millions hungry. However, the worst was avoided due to a series of new export corridors that have kept the grain flowing.

Hi, I’m Sharon Gill, and I’m the author of this book “war time wound care for anyone. I’ve dedicated my life to healing. My medical education provided me with knowledge to learn the devastating impact of war firsthand. The wounds—both physical and emotional—leave scars that extend far beyond the battlefield.

Why did I write this book on wound care? Because I believe knowledge can be a beacon of hope. By sharing practical, life-saving techniques, I hope to empower those caught in the crossfire. Whether it’s a child in Gaza or a soldier in Russia, understanding wound care can mean the difference between life and death.

My mission extends beyond bandages and sutures. I envision a world where healthcare bridges divides, where compassion transcends borders. This book isn’t just about stopping bleeding; it’s about stitching together fractured communities. It’s about turning trauma into resilience.

The hard copies of this book will find their way to war-torn regions. From Gaza to Rafah, Israel to Poland, language won’t be a barrier. Every page carries the promise of healing. And soon, it’ll be available on Amazon, reaching even more hands.

Why? Because I believe in education as a force for peace. When we understand how to care for one another, we build bridges. When children read these words, they might dream of becoming doctors, nurses, or scientists—the healers of tomorrow.

So, let’s turn the page together. Let’s transform knowledge into action, wounds into scars, and chaos into harmony. I’m thrilled to be an author of this book, sharing my perspective and expertise with women, children, and anyone who believes in the power of healing. 🌟

These are a few pages of my book, the full published book will be available for purchase if you live in US, CANADA, UK & AUSTRALIA & FREE OF COST FOR ANYONE FROM ANY OTHER COUNTRY BESIDES THE ONES MENTIONED. 
.
Thank you for your support. I aim to make peace 🕊️
.

New Zealand's Defence Minister, Judith Collins, has announced a notable reduction in the nation's defense budget, proposing a cut of 6.6%. This decision arises amidst ongoing challenges related to personnel and equipment within the New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF). According to the Defence Minister's office, the current budgetary reduction aims to address these critical issues by reallocating resources and ensuring better financial management.

The government's conservative administration is responsible for this budgetary adjustment. Despite the reduction, the government has also allocated a substantial sum of $571 million to the defense sector. This funding aims to address pay raises for Defence Force personnel and invest in various projects and equipment upgrades.

Despite the proposed cuts, the government has simultaneously committed to a substantial investment of $571 million to bolster the NZDF. Announced on May 10, 2024, this funding is specifically targeted towards improving pay for Defence Force personnel and upgrading critical equipment and infrastructure. The Defence Minister emphasized that this allocation is intended to enhance the operational readiness and welfare of the NZDF, even as the overall budget sees a reduction.

I will be having on the podcast this week the CEO of Bliss Farm Integrated, Oyeleke Oluwakayode, S. 

Bliss Farm Integrated runs a farm to table service, in Ibadan, where, employing traceability and food entertainment, consumers are given unique experience with products farmed fresh and cooked for retail in a fun ambience and the consumers carried along in the journey.

Oyeleke would be sharing valuable insights on ensuring a sustainable agribusiness in a chaotic business environment of today.

Food and agricultural businesses have been one of the most impacted ventures by and left with lasting effects of ravaging macroeconomic events of the last few years.

At least 50% of the nation’s poultry farms has shutdown to this.

This is similar event in the quick service restaurant sector (QSR) losing more than half of its over ₦250 billion worth.

The Bliss Farm integrated operates in both the food and agribusiness sector and has witnessed and been impacted by these macroeconomic occurences. 

It farms and was affected by input supply chain disruption of Russia-Ukraine conflict and covid pandemic and also low patronage from lockdown and movement restriction of the latter. It also was battered by dwindled purchasing power to cash crunch, inflation and recession.

Despite facing all these, Bliss Farm stood tall weathering these challenges and growing bigger even establishing multiple branches across Ibadan.

This is to the prowess of Oluwakayode in thinking ahead and evolving formidable strategy -that encompasses cost effectiveness, business pivoting and product development, and effective operational and strategic managements. 

It why when I thought of this topic Oyeleke and his company were the perfect match. 

You want to anticipate this podcast and listen to it as it promises potent insights that would help with sustainably managing and scaling your agribusiness.

The counteroffensive last year fell short, resulting in Russia's significant recapture of Avdiivka. President Zelensky has acknowledged this new military reality, and the Biden Administration’s strategy now aims to sustain Ukraine's defense until after the U.S. presidential elections, hoping to exhaust Russian forces in a prolonged war of attrition. However, this approach has significant implications and potential flaws not fully addressed in public discourse.

The critical implication of this strategy is the indefinite loss of territories currently occupied by Russia. Russia is unlikely to relinquish these lands at the negotiating table. While Ukraine should not formally surrender these territories, their status may need to be deferred for future talks, akin to the Cyprus situation, where negotiations have persisted for decades without resolution or renewed conflict.

The Biden Administration must also align American public opinion with this reality. Supporters of a complete Ukrainian victory may hold overly optimistic views, such as the notion of driving Russia out of Crimea through missile bombardment—a strategy deemed impractical given Ukraine’s limited amphibious capabilities.

A more realistic scenario involves Ukraine inflicting significant losses on Russian forces while on the defensive, potentially enabling a successful counterattack in 2025. However, this relies on continuous Western weapon supplies and favorable battlefield conditions, which are uncertain.

The Biden Administration should test Putin’s readiness for peace talks, which would require painful concessions from Ukraine and the West. Nonetheless, these concessions are more emotional than practical and are preferable to prolonged conflict and potential Ukrainian defeat. Recognizing the lost territories and focusing on Ukraine's current borders could pave the way for a feasible peace settlement and prevent further devastation. #talkdiplomacy #upsc #css #cuet #UkraineWar

Citing the 'unprecedented' conflicts that broke out in Ukraine and Gaza, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that coming years will be "very difficult", adding that once a conflict starts, it continues to escalate on its own.

He said that no one expected the Russia-Ukraine conflict to continue for over three years, or an attack on Israel of such a massive scale taking place on October 7.

The EAM was interacting with the first-time voters at Delhi Tamil Association School in the national capital on Monday.
Addressing the event, Jaishankar said, "We all should expect the coming years to be very difficult. Nobody expected that there would be a war in Ukraine. Even when it started, people expected it to be over in a few weeks, a few months. We are now in the third year of war with Ukraine with no end in sight...Nobody expected this kind of an attack on Israel in October, that this level of damage and killing would be done, or when Israel responded this would go for so long. It's already over six months."

روسیه می‌‏گوید ۱۶ موشک و ۳۱ پهپاد پرتاب شده ازسوی اوکراین را سرنگون کرده است

وزارت دفاع روسیه روز دوشنبه ۱۳مه، اعلام کرد که سامانه‌های دفاع هوایی این کشور ۱۶ موشک و ۳۱ پهپاد را که اوکراین در شبانه‌روز گذشته به خاک روسیه پرتاب کرده بود، منهدم کرده است.

رویترز به نقل از روسیه نوشته است که روز یکشنبه، ۱۵ نفر در بلگورود بر اثر اصابت قطعات یک موشک متعلق به دوران شوروی که توسط اوکراین پرتاب و توسط نیروهای روسی سرنگون شد، در شهر بلگورود در نزدیکی مرز اوکراین کشته شدند.

وزارت دفاع روسیه روز دوشنبه اعلام کرد که ۱۲ موشک هدایت شونده از یک راکت انداز چندگانه اوکراینی پرتاب شده است.

این وزارتخانه همچنین گفت که چهار فروند موشک و هفت پهپاد بر فراز کریمه سرنگون شدند. همچنین هشت پهپاد بر فراز منطقه کورسک و چهار فروند پهپاد بر فراز منطقه لیپتسک منهدم شدند.

ایگور آرتامونوف، فرماندار منطقه  کورسک در جنوب روسیه در تلگرام نوشت: «یک پهپاد باعث آتش سوزی کوتاه مدت در یک پست برق در منطقه کورسک شد.

آرتامونوف گفت: «این حادثه تلفات جانی نداشته است. آتش سوزی در محدوده پست برق در حال خاموش شدن است.»

هیچ اظهار نظر فوری از سوی اوکراین وجود نداشته است. کی‌یف می‌گوید که هدف قرار دادن زیرساخت های نظامی، حمل و نقل و انرژی روسیه، تلاش‌های جنگی مسکو را تضعیف می‌کند و پاسخی به حملات مرگبار بی شمار روسیه است.

KYIV ­— Ukraine’s security service said Tuesday it had foiled a plot to assassinate President Volodymyr Zelensky by undercover Ukrainian security officials who were working for Russia.

Two unnamed colonels from the Ukrainian State Security Department, the SBU , the main organization protecting top officials including Zelensky, were part of a group of covert agents helping Russia’s security service, the FSB, to plot the assassination, Kyiv said.

The colonels were arrested and Kyiv said the conspiracy included plans to also murder SBU chief Vasyl Malyuk and Military Intelligence boss Kyrylo Budanov.Zelensky has previously said he has survived more than 10 assassination attempts. “But it is the first time such a high-ranking official of the state security department has become the enemy’s moles,- Artem Dehtiarenko, SBU spokesman.

One of the tasks of the FSB intelligence network was to search for executors among the military close to the protection of the president, who could first take him hostage and later kill him,”- the SBU press service said in a statement.

Besides Zelensky, a group of FSB agents including the defector colonels were planning to assassinate spymaster Budanov, Kyiv said.

Following his criticism of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Rabbi Pinchas Goldschmidt and his family were forced to flee Russia, fearing their immediate arrest. Goldschmidt has since been labeled a “Foreign Agent” by Russia, becoming the first religious leader in Russia to be named as such, a title he carries with distinction. 

Today, Rabbi Goldschmidt serves as the President of the Conference of European Rabbis, an umbrella organization which advocates on behalf of Jewish communities across Europe. For his work, he is being presented with the 2024 Charlemagne Prize, awarded for work done in the service of European unification. 

Rabbi Goldschmidt  believes that the Kremlin is one of the key players fomenting dissent on college campuses across the US.. He believes hatred towards Jews on campuses should be confronted and communities in Europe are combating similar challenges.  He also believesAmerica and Western democracies should align themselves with Ukraine and Israel.

The Moscow Exchange halted trading in U.S. dollars and euros on Thursday following new U.S. sanctions targeting Russia's financial sector amidst the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

"Due to the imposition of restrictive measures by the United States against the Moscow Exchange Group, starting June 13, 2024, trading on the Moscow Exchange markets will exclude instruments settled in U.S. dollars and euros," the exchange announced.

Additionally, the U.S. sanctioned Russia’s National Clearing Center, which facilitates foreign exchange transactions.

On Wednesday, the U.S. Treasury Department expanded its sanctions, targeting over 300 entities, including those in Russia and allied nations such as China, Turkey, and the UAE, aiming to restrict the flow of money and goods supporting Russia's war efforts.

A military court in Moscow has reportedly sentenced Meta Platforms spokesperson Andy Stone to six years in prison in absentia for ‘publicly defending terrorism.’ This ruling comes amid Russia’s crackdown on Meta, which was designated as an extremist organisation in the country, resulting in the banning of Facebook and Instagram in 2022 due to Russia’s conflict with Ukraine.

Meta has yet to comment on the reported sentencing of Stone, who serves as the company’s communications director. Stone himself was unavailable for immediate response following the court’s decision. Stone’s lawyer, Valentina Filippenkova, indicated they intend to appeal the verdict, expressing a request for acquittal.

The Russian interior ministry initiated a criminal investigation against Stone late last year, although the specific charges were not disclosed then. According to state investigators, Stone’s online comments allegedly defended ‘aggressive, hostile, and violent actions’ against Russian soldiers involved in what Russia terms its ‘special military operation’ in Ukraine.

Banyak cara dan strategi Rusia untuk menjatuhkan mental pasukan Ukraina di medan perang sekaligus mempermalukan negara Barat anggota NATO yang selama ini jadi sekutu Ukraina. 

Satu diantaranya dengan menyelenggarakan pameran senjata hasil rampasan perang selama konflik Rusia melawan Ukraina di Kota Moskow.

Sebuah pameran peralatan militer Barat yang dirampas dari pasukan Kyiv selama pertempuran di Ukraina dibuka di ibu kota Rusia pada Rabu (1/5). 

Pameran yang diselenggarakan oleh Kementerian Pertahanan Rusia itu menampilkan lebih dari 30 alat berat buatan Barat, termasuk tank tempur M1 Abrams buatan AS dan kendaraan tempur lapis baja Bradley, tank Leopard 2 dan kendaraan infanteri lapis baja Marder dari Jerman, dan kendaraan lapis baja AMX-10RC buatan Prancis.

Lokasi pameran senjata itu diadakan di Victory Park, Moskow. Sebuah taman yang didedikasikan untuk kemenangan USSR terhadap Nazi pada Perang Dunia 2 dahulu.

Lokasi itu juga merupakan tempat dimana Napoleon Bonaparte berdiri pada 1812 sebelum memasuki Moskow pada Perang Patriot melawan Prancis

The Russian invasion of Ukraine began on February 24 2022, days after Russia recognised two breakaway Ukrainian republics. Russia’s invasion was, in fact, an escalation of the Russo-Ukrainian War that started in 2014. The invasion became the largest attack on a European country since World War II. The invasion has caused tens of thousands of Ukrainian civilian casualties and hundreds of thousands of military casualties. By June 2022, Russian troops occupied about 20% of Ukrainian territory.

From a population of 41 million in January 2022, about 8 million Ukrainians had been internally displaced and more than 8.2 million had fled the country by April 2023, creating Europe’s largest refugee crisis since World War II. Extensive environmental damage caused by the war led to global food crises. The war rages on but media fatigue has taken it off from the headlines. By September 2022, military costs were estimated at $40 billion. The 2022 GDP losses amounted to between $81 billion and $104 billion and financial capital destruction reached $322 billion by year-end.

Russia has announced plans to integrate drone operations into the curriculum of schools located in occupied territories, effective September 1. This decision has sparked outrage, with many condemning it as a blatant violation of international law and humanitarian principles.

Ivan Fedorov, the head of the Zaporizhzhia Regional State Administration, took to Telegram to denounce the Kremlin's actions, stating, "From September 1, 2024, schools in the temporarily occupied territories of Ukraine will introduce a new subject – a course on controlling unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV). Officially, they may call it ‘training,’ but in reality they are preparing young people to kill."

This revelation comes after Ukraine's National Resistance Center (NRC) disclosed similar plans by Russia earlier this year. According to the NRC, the curriculum will cover technical aspects and assembly of UAVs for military purposes, while also encouraging further education in technical fields and employment in military industries among students.

Fedorov further emphasized that Russia intends to provide every school with training UAVs and deploy Russian military personnel to instruct children. However, such actions are deeply concerning, as training minors for military purposes and potentially involving them in conflicts against their own nation constitute grave violations of international law.

The international community has expressed alarm over Russia's decision, calling for diplomatic efforts to address the situation and protect the rights of affected children. As tensions persist, the implications of this controversial move extend far beyond the borders of the occupied territories.

YEMEN:  Two-year-old Eyad is badly malnourished and is given water by his mother in a hospital bed in Sanaa. This picture is from 2018 when journalist @tparabien and I visited Yemen to document the effects of the then three-year-long civil war. Nearly three years have passed since then but the situation, unfortunately, has only changed for the wors. 80% of the population are in need of humanitarian aid and despite everything happening in the world the UN still regard this as the worlds worst humanitarian crisis.
After a brief increase in attention and aid to the country back in 2018 last year especially have been hard on the population struggling with increased flooding, less outside aid and the effects of covid19-restrictions.
Let's help spread the word about this terrible humanitarian tragedy.

गुणैरुत्तमतां याति नोच्चैरासनसंस्थितः।

Winston Churchill once said that “History is written by the victors”. There could be contrary views to this assertion, but this testimony surely does not resonate with the case of Russia-Ukraine War. As we are advancing, the complete collapse of Ukrainian Territory at the hands Russian Federation seems inevitable. 

But I suspect that this will ever go down in History the way things have truly unfolded. Well, the history is not really written by the victors, rather it is written by someone who is really good with documentation and narrative.

The book “Russia Forever” is a timely intervention into the field of geopolitical literature. Penned by Ashish Shukla, a geopolitical analyst who has shown his presence on International Media. If you follow the international media today, remarks in the favour of Ukraine truly dominates the narrative. 

The contemporary war in the region is not new. The seed of it was sowed back in 2014 with the Russia’s annexation of Crimea. But what were the reasons behind which forced Russians to barge into a sovereign state and to create it as buffer zone between NATO (Europe) and Itself?

The book draws you to a detailed background of this conflict which traces its roots back in time. Under Gorbachev, Russians were told about the Enlargement of NATO and a “guaranteed non-expansion of NATO in Eastern Europe”. 

But over the period of time, the bearers of utmost morality and truth — The Americans, gushed from the words of assurance given to the Russians and NATO expanded heavily & aggressively in Eastern Europe. Seeing it as a potential threat to the Russian Sovereignty, the invasion of Crimea happened followed by the current ongoing war.
.
.

The US House of Representatives has approved a $60.84 billion security aid package for Ukraine, with $23 billion allocated for replenishing US weapons and facilities. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov warns that the decision could exacerbate destruction and loss of life 

Instagram Caption: The US House of Representatives has approved a $60.84 billion security aid package for Ukraine, with $23 billion allocated for replenishing US weapons and facilities. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov warns that the decision could exacerbate destruction and loss of life in the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Russia is concerned about provisions that allow the confiscation of Russian assets to fund Ukraine's reconstruction efforts. Critics, such as former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev, argue that the aid is motivated by Russophobia and benefits the US military-industrial complex. Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova cautions that this assistance could deepen global crises, particularly in Taiwan and Israel.

Russel Bentley, conosciuto con il nom de guerre di Texas e "Il Cowboy del Donbass" era un cittadino americano, texano che nel 2014 andò nel Donbass per combattere con le milizie separatiste di Donetsk. Circa due settimane fa la moglie una ucraina di Donetsk, ne denunciò la scomparsa, ed alcuni giorni fa è stato ritrovato il cadavere di Bentley. I canali filo-russi inizialmente hanno accusato gli ucraini, ma pare siano stati gli stessi russi ad eliminarlo brutalmente. Si parla di un regolamento di conti per questioni criminali, al fatto che alcuni reparti russi al sentirlo parlare inglese e non conoscendolo abbiano pensato ad una spia; l'ipotesi più probabile è che sia stato rapito, torturato e ucciso dal 5into battaglione Tank, composto esclusivamente da Buriati.

"Russia-Ukraine Unveiled" is going to put a spotlight on the issue by offering a balanced viewpoint. In a situation likely to be accompanied by discrimination and agitation, Dr. Thomas bravely handles the narrative by presenting a balanced side of the whole story. Despite the difficulty of the issue and the complexity and contradictory aspects of the relationship, he does not fall into either generalization or simplistic narratives. Rather he invites people to dive deeper and came up with your irrefutable views.

Apart from that, the writer not only analyzes but also tells the story in a way that is attention-grabbing and clear. He does not drench his readers with statistics and fact-piles but weaves stories which humanize the conflict making people able to empathize and relate to the subject on a personal level. Through this method it becomes more readable and empathy creation get also rise and it is very vital in such theme.

The book not only provides great analysis but is a sign of Dr. Thomas's dedication to both education and philanthropy. Through his words, he communicates his zeal for making people know more. His readers are encouraged to experience the topic further, and to utilize analytical thinking skills in addressing the issues.

Briefly, "Russia-Ukraine Unveiled" is an outstanding exhibit of intricate geopolitical position. Dr. Joseph K. Thomas's knowledge and his gripping narrative style provide the main reasons why this book belongs in the reading list of everyone who wants to know more about the Russian-Ukrainian relations on a global level. It is an eloquent demonstration of the strength of the human intellect and its capacity to take on not only the intricacy but the changing environment of our world.

"Russia-Ukraine Unveiled" by Dr. Joseph K Thomas is a compelling book that takes us through the history, complexities, and current relations of the two nations: Russia and Ukraine. 

The book presents facts and paints a vivid picture of the two nations and their struggles. Russia and Ukraine's conflict have affected the whole world, and this book made me aware of many such aspects. I appreciate Dr. Joseph's narration, which kept me hooked, and the descriptions that offered rich insights. 

Dr. Joseph's writing style is engaging and easy to understand, making complex issues and topics accessible. 

"Russia-Ukraine Unveiled" is a well-researched book and a must-read for anyone interested in history, politics, or simply curious to know more about the world.

Rating : 4⭐

Igor "Strelkov" Ghirkin, ex colonnello dell'FSB, "ministro della difesa" della Repubblica Separatista di Donetsk, in più di una decina di guerre dagli anni '90 ad oggi. Ha combattuto in Transnistria come volontario del 2º plotone del vojsko cosacco del Mar Nero; in Bosnia a fianco dei serbi Corpo di volontari russi in Jugoslavia ed Esercito della Repubblica Serva di Bosnia ed Erzegovina,ed in Cecenia, durante la prima e la seconda guerra cecena. 
Nelle prime tre foto Strelkov con la "Compagnia Crimea", un battaglione di 200 uomini che guidò l'annessione della Crimea alla Russia, colpendo nello specifico obbiettivi Tatari ed ucraini nella penisola.

Since the unification of Yemen in 1990 the political, economic and military leadership was dominated by the Northerners which resulted in continuous conflicts. They however continued to work together in the fight against Al Qaeda and Houthis.

The failure of President Hadi against Al Qaeda and Houthis encouraged the revival of a long suppressed secessionist movement in Southern Yemen, Al-Hirak al-Janoubi commonly called Hirak.

In 2018, the Separatists occupied the government at Aden in a coup d’état against the Hadi government and in April 2020 declared self-rule in Aden, saying it would govern the port city and southern provinces.

So in effect Yemen is now governed by three separate entities, Houthis in North Yemen, STC and Hadi faction in Southern part of Yemen. Apart from this in many of the areas of tribal hinterland, Al Qaeda is running its writ.

To read more check the link in bio.

The recent drone attack on Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia power plant, a critical nuclear facility with six reactors, has intensified fears of a potential catastrophic nuclear accident, as cautioned by the UN's atomic watchdog, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). Tensions between Russia and Ukraine have reached a critical point, with both sides trading accusations regarding the attack. While Russia alleges Ukrainian involvement, Ukraine vehemently denies any responsibility. The IAEA's Director General, Rafael Grossi, described the drone strike as reckless and a significant escalation in the already precarious situation surrounding nuclear safety and security at the plant. The Zaporizhzhia facility, located in southern Ukraine, holds the distinction of being the largest nuclear power plant in Europe. Since the full-scale invasion by Russian forces in February 2022, the plant has been under Russian control. Despite assurances from the plant's administration that radiation levels remain within acceptable limits and that there is no substantial damage, the IAEA has expressed concerns about the potential impact on the integrity of the reactor's containment system. This incident underscores the grave risks posed by the ongoing conflict and the imperative of safeguarding nuclear facilities to prevent a potentially catastrophic outcome.

**Sweden’s NATO Entry Marks New Era in European Security, Bolsters Support for Ukraine Amidst Ongoing Conflict** 

Amidst the ongoing conflict, Sweden’s announcement of its most substantial single support package to Ukraine, valued at 682 million, signifies a significant escalation in aid. This comprehensive assistance includes air defense systems, anti-tank weapons, and more, demonstrating Sweden’s unwavering commitment to Ukraine’s defense and sovereignty. Additionally, the Swedish defense industry, exemplified by Nammo’s artillery shell production, is intensifying efforts to meet the urgent needs of Ukrainian forces amidst the conflict.

Moscow has blocked access to 81 Western media sites from 25 EU nations, accusing them of spreading false information about its "special military operation" in Ukraine. The term "war" or "invasion" is criminalized in Russia. This move follows the EU's decision in May to ban four Russian media outlets, which Brussels labelled as Kremlin propaganda. The blocked Western outlets include AFP, Der Spiegel, El Pais, and state broadcasters from Austria, Ireland, and Italy. Politico was also banned. European Commission Vice President Vera Jourova condemned Moscow's action as "nonsense" on social media.

Russia's Foreign Ministry stated that the ban would be reconsidered if the EU lifted its Russian media restrictions, which they described as politically motivated. The escalation in media restrictions comes amid heightened tensions following Russia's 2022 invasion of Ukraine. Many Western media organizations had already withdrawn staff from Russia to avoid repercussions under new laws against "discrediting" the Russian military. The latest ban coincides with the espionage trial of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, who has been detained for a year. Russia's ranking on the Press Freedom Index remains low, with frequent reports of journalists being jailed, harassed, or killed.
Source: AFP, AP, Reuters

So what
Russia is well aware that they are currently in an information war, and they have a long history of using propaganda dating back to before the soviet revolution. While the internet has allowed people to get their media from various sources, it has also allowed state actors to flood the information space with competing narratives to sow confusion (one of Russia's favoured tactics). It is possible that this move comes due to Western governments finally taking note of the information war and looking to put more effort into winning it. Additionally, it is likely that as the conflict in Ukraine drags on, Russians have looked for alternative narratives around what is happening, something the Kremlin will want to subdue.

'Chinese reactions to Modi’s visit to Ukraine reflect a range of perspectives. 

One analysis provided three key reasons for Modi’s Ukraine visit. First, it suggests that Modi’s visit aligns with a utilitarian approach to diplomacy: while Russia offers valuable resources and technology to India, the West provides markets and investment opportunities. Thus, Modi’s trip can be seen as part of a strategic effort to balance these interests.

Second, by engaging directly with Ukraine and trying to mediate the conflict, Modi aims to bolster his image as a prominent global leader, enhancing India’s stature on the world stage.

Third, the visit is viewed through the lens of competition with China. The commentary highlighted that India’s desire to match China’s diplomatic moves is evident, especially following Beijing’s recent invitation to Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dymtro Kuleba. Modi’s visit, announced shortly after Kuleba’s departure from China on 26 July, seems strategically timed to capitalise on this competitive dynamic.'

Link in bio to complete column by Sana Hashmi, fellow at Taiwan-Asia Exchange Foundation.

What Happened: Turkey to submit declaration to International Court of Justice intervening in South Africa's case against Israel over alleged genocide in Gaza.

What you need to know: Turkey will submit a declaration to the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Wednesday, intervening in a case against Israel regarding alleged genocide in Gaza. The declaration aims to bring attention to the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and support South Africa's case. 

More: Turkey's move follows Spain's similar intervention in June. Israel has denied the genocide accusations, claiming its actions in Gaza are self-defense measures targeting Hamas militants. The ICJ, established in 1945, will consider the declarations as it reviews the case. 

Also: Turkey's foreign minister announced the move, which comes after Turkey increased measures against Israel over the Gaza assault. The submission will take place at 1330 GMT on Wednesday.

New course topic coming fall 2024! This fall, HIST 153 will feature an additional theme: Israel, Palestine, and Christianity: A Historical Perspective.

In this 2-hr half-semester core humanities course, Professor Martin Spence and his students will explore the historical roots of the Israel-Palestine conflict. Topics covered include the decline of the Ottoman Empire, the development of Jewish and Arab nationalism, the two World Wars, British imperialism, and the causes, character, and consequences of the foundation of the modern state of Israel in 1948. The class will also explore the historical forces that have shaped western Christian perspectives on the topic, including Christian Zionism, end times theology, and religious nationalism.

This course is being offered for both the first and second halves of the semester. Register soon—seats are limited!

With the fall of the Ottoman Empire, the League of Nations assigned Palestine to a British mandate in 1920. This 1935 Palestine coin features “Palestine” written in British Mandate Palestine’s three official languages: English, Arabic, and Hebrew. Article 22 of the 1922 Palestine Mandate states: “Any statement or inscription in Arabic on stamps or money in Palestine shall be repeated in Hebrew, and any statement or inscription in Hebrew shall be repeated in Arabic.” The British administration at times supported creating a “national home” in Palestine for Jewish people as stated in the 1917 Balfour Declaration. This support was echoed in the language choices the British Mandate enforced on the coins.

Rocket Attack in Israel’s Golan Heights Kills 12: Tensions Escalate

On July 27, 2024, a rocket fired from Lebanon struck a soccer field in Majdal Shams, a Druze town in the Israeli-controlled Golan Heights, killing 12 children and teenagers. The attack, described as the deadliest on civilians since October 7, 2023, has heightened fears of a broader regional conflict, as reported by AP. 

The Israeli military reported that the rocket caused extensive damage and that 20 others were injured. Residents described the scene as horrific, with many expressing a deep sense of loss and anger. Israeli officials are investigating why the rocket was not intercepted by defense systems.

In response, Israel has conducted airstrikes on targets in Lebanon, marking an escalation in the ongoing cross-border conflict with Hezbollah. Despite these strikes, Hezbollah has denied responsibility for the attack, while the U.S. and Israeli officials point to indications that it was involved.

The incident comes amid stalled negotiations for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas in Gaza. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed that Hezbollah will face severe consequences. The Israeli security cabinet is deliberating on further actions, while international efforts, led by the U.S. and Egypt, are pushing for de-escalation.

This escalation threatens to further destabilize the region, already tense from the ongoing Gaza conflict and frequent border skirmishes. The White House National Security Council is engaging with Israeli and Lebanese counterparts to seek a diplomatic resolution and prevent further violence.

Amid the ongoing Israel-Palestine conflict, Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh and one of his bodyguards have been killed in Tehran.

Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) has confirmed the killings in a statement.
The statement adds that Ismail Haniyeh, the leader of the Islamist group Hamas that runs the Palestinian territory of Gaza, was "assassinated."

"With condolences to the heroic nation of Palestine and the Islamic nation and combatants of the Resistant Front and the noble nation of Iran, this morning [Wednesday] the residence of Ismail Haniyeh, the head of the political office of the Islamic Resistance of Hamas, was hit in Tehran, and following this incident, he and one of his bodyguards were martyred," the IRGC statement read.

The Islamist outfit has blamed Israel and claimed that Haniyeh was killed in a "treacherous Zionist raid on his residence in Tehran." The group said an investigation is ongoing to find out more details about the attack.

Kamala Harris, Wakil Presiden Amerika Serikat, telah menyampaikan perubahan besar dalam kebijakan AS terkait perang Gaza. Dalam pertemuan dengan Perdana Menteri Israel, Benjamin Netanyahu, di Washington, Harris menyerukan diakhirinya konflik dan mendukung pembentukan negara Palestina. Dia menegaskan bahwa AS tidak akan tinggal diam terhadap penderitaan yang dialami oleh rakyat Palestina.

Harris mengkritik pendekatan Presiden Joe Biden yang mendukung Israel dan menyoroti penderitaan yang terjadi di Gaza selama sembilan bulan terakhir. Dia menggambarkan gambar anak-anak yang tewas dan orang-orang yang putus asa serta kelaparan yang terus berusaha melarikan diri demi keselamatan. Harris menegaskan bahwa dunia tidak bisa berpaling dari tragedi ini dan bahwa dia tidak akan tinggal diam.

Dalam pertemuan tersebut, Harris menekankan kepada Netanyahu tentang skala penderitaan manusia di Gaza dan kematian warga sipil yang tidak bersalah. Dia juga menyatakan keprihatinan serius tentang situasi kemanusiaan di sana. Selain itu, Harris menyerukan gencatan senjata antara Israel dan Hamas serta pembebasan sandera untuk mengakhiri perang yang dimulai pada Oktober 2023.

Pernyataan Harris ini sangat berbeda dengan pendekatan ramah antara Biden dan Netanyahu sebelumnya. Sikap tegas Harris menunjukkan bahwa dia mungkin mengambil pendekatan yang lebih keras terhadap Israel dibandingkan Biden. Harris juga mengutuk anti-Semitisme, Islamofobia, dan segala bentuk kebencian, serta menyerukan persatuan dalam menghadapi situasi ini.

Menurut Kementerian Kesehatan Gaza, sebanyak 39.175 warga tewas karena serangan Israel, dengan 90.000 \orang lainnya terluka. Harris menyampaikan bahwa gencatan senjata dan bantuan kemanusiaan sangat dibutuhkan untuk mengurangi penderitaan warga sipil yang tidak bersalah di Gaza.

Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh was killed in an attack on his residence in Tehran, confirmed by Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC).

If Israel is blamed for this, Hamas could significantly escalate its response. This comes right after Israel struck the capital of Lebanon to target Hezbollah.

It creates a leadership vacuum in Hamas as no successor has been announced yet.

In April, his video of reacting to the deaths of three of his sons and other relatives in an Israeli airstrike went viral after he said they were 'awarded this honour.'

Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh and one of his bodyguards were killed after their residence was targeted in Tehran, confirmed by IRGC in a statement.

Haniyeh had attended the inauguration of Iran's new president and met Iran's Supreme Leader the day before the attack.

• The attack on Haniyeh's residence is being investigated, and results will be announced later in the day.

• The IRGC's Public Relations Department stated that the attack was carried out early Wednesday, and a probe is underway to find the cause of the incident.

• The IRGC extended condolences to the people of Palestine, the Muslim world, and the Resistance Front's fighters.

A Russian missile strike on a residential area in central Lviv, Ukraine, has left 7 people dead, including two children aged 7 and 14. The attack also injured 53 others, while 12 people were rescued.⁣
 ⁣
In a separate overnight strike, five people were wounded in Kryvyi Rih, the hometown of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, according to regional head Serhii Lysak.⁣
 ⁣
In response to the attacks, Zelenskyy urged Ukraine’s allies to provide Kyiv with “more range” in Western weapons to strike deeper into Russian territory.⁣
 ⁣

“The myth of Israel as a democracy has no factual basis, yet it, too, has become an indisputable fact. Israel has from the very beginning defined itself as a racist apartheid state that prefers Jews. No attempt has been made to hide this fact, and for almost seven decades Israeli lawmakers have made it their business to develop the state for the Jewish population at the expense of the Palestinian population, be they citizens, residents or simply people living without any legal definition at all. Palestinians have been pushed out of every aspect of the life of the state from the very beginning, not to mention the fact that they were pushed out of the country and not allowed to return. The web of laws that govern the lives of Palestinians, whether they live in Jaffa, Haifa, Jerusalem, the Naqab desert, Ramallah, Jenin or Khan Younis, is too complicated to even attempt to understand, yet regardless of where in Palestine Palestinians reside, they are governed by the state of Israel under laws that are vastly different than the ones that govern the lives of Jewish Israelis.”
--Miko Peled
.

The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) committee saw India articulate a neutral stance, refraining from taking sides in the Israel-Palestine conflict. Palestine issued a strong condemnation of Israel, accusing it of bombing refugee camps and hospitals, and called for adherence to international law. In response, Israel asserted that Hamas is exploiting civilian groups. Denmark voiced support for a humanitarian ceasefire, emphasizing the urgent need to address the humanitarian crisis. The debate highlighted the complex dynamics of the ongoing conflict, with nations expressing diverse perspectives on the situation. As discussions continue, the committee seeks to navigate these challenging issues while working towards a resolution that prioritizes civilian safety and international cooperation.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's combative speech to the US Congress sparked protests and highlighted divisions in American society over the Gaza war.

Kamala Harris, believed to be the Democrats' presidential candidate did not attend Netanyahu's speech, signaling solidarity with the protesters, which would be a tricky position for the Democrats' foreign policy, if she were to win the elections.
She was attending a campaign rally in Indiana instead.

Netanyahu emphasized the close ties between the US and Israel, calling for unity in their fight against Hamas and other Iran-backed groups.

His speech was met with applause from many lawmakers but also boycotts by over 60 Democrats and political independent Bernie Sanders, as per News18.

Netanyahu did not directly address ongoing US-led mediation for a cease-fire and hostage-release, showing no eagerness for such a deal.

Meanwhile, Thousands of protesters gathered near the Capitol, calling for a ceasefire and condemning Netanyahu, with some protesters burning the American flag too.

Excavation works began Wednesday in the town of Tal Afar in Mosul, northern Iraq, with the discovery of a mass grave thought to contain the remains of Turkmen victims who were all likely killed by Daesh between 2014 and 2017.

Thousands of Iraqi Turkmen families who have been missing their loved ones for years are waiting for the bodies of their relatives to be recovered from what is known as Daesh's "massacre well" locally.

The well, known locally as "Allov Anter," is about ten kilometers south of Tal Afar and plunges deeper than 100 meters. Daesh dubbed it the "Well of Hell." After capturing control of the region on June 9, 2014, Daesh allegedly killed thousands of people and disposed of their bodies in the well.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu have thanked US lawmakers after they voted in favor of new aid packages for their countries worth billions of dollars.

“Thank you friends, thank you America!” said Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a post on social media, adding that the bill demonstrates “strong bipartisan support for Israel and defends Western civilization.” 

“Thank you, America!” Zelensky wrote on his Telegram on Saturday, shortly after the House of Representatives passed the long-delayed Ukraine Security Supplemental Appropriations Act by a vote of 311-112.

The bill was part of a wider $95 billion package providing foreign aid for Ukraine, Israel and the Indo-Pacific region. It provides nearly $61 billion to help Ukraine and others in the region fight Russia, while the House also passed funding worth $26.4 billion for Israel and $8.1 billion to counter China’s actions in the Indo-Pacific.

Colum McCann begleitet mich schon seit „Der Tänzer“. Der Journalist schreibt unglaublich dicht erzählte, aufwendig recherchierte Romane über ganz unterschiedliche Themen, die mich bisher (bis auf „Transatlantik“) immer tief beeindruckt haben. Sie brachten mir einen russischen Balletttänzer, die Erbauer der New Yorker U-Bahn, eine dichtende Roma und das New York der 1970er Jahre nahe. In seinem neusten Werk, das schon 2020 erschien, schreibt der Ire nun über den israelisch-palästinensischen Konflikt. Doch ein bisschen weit hergeholt? Ich finde nicht. Gerade aus der Distanz heraus gelingt es ihm, dieses Thema in unzähligen Facetten zu beleuchten, die einen die aktuellen Ereignisse so viel besser verstehen lassen. Neutral ist McCann dabei nicht. Durch die Stimmen seiner Protagonisten, dem Palästinenser Bassam und dem Israeli Rami, übermittelt er eine klare Botschaft: Sie werben für eine friedliche Lösung und das Ende der Besatzung.
 
Die beiden Protagonisten sind reale Personen. Beide verloren ein Kind im Konflikt und schworen daraufhin nicht etwa blutige Rache, sondern schlossen sich der Organisation „Parents Circle“ an, um die Geschichte ihrer Töchter publik zu machen, gegenseitiges Verständnis zwischen Juden und Arabern zu vermitteln und für das Ende der Gewalt einzutreten. Erzählt wird diese Geschichte in vielen kurzen Informationsbruchstücken. Der Name des Romans ist dabei Programm: „Apeirogon“ bezeichnet eine geometrische Figur mit einer nahezu unendlichen Menge Seiten. Nicht bei jedem dieser Informationshäppchen wird der Zusammenhang direkt deutlich. Da ist viel von verschiedenen Vögelarten die Rede, private Geschichten von Politikern oder historischen Persönlichkeiten kommen zur Sprache, mathematische Lehren werden wiedergegeben. Sogar den Tunnelbauern aus „Der Himmel unter der Stadt“ und dem Motiv des Seiltänzers aus „Die große Welt“ begegnen wir wieder. 

⬇️⬇️⬇️ Weiter in den Kommentaren

Gerade ausgelesen.

tl;dr: Ein im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes facettenreicher, auf einer wahren Geschichte beruhender Roman über den Nahostkonflikt.

JOIN US THIS SUNDAY NIGHT ON AN IMPORTANT JOURNEY OF DISCOVERY & DIALOGUE!

We invite our church family on a three-part teaching series exploring the complex and often contentious legacy of the land that both Israelis and Palestinians call home. We will trace the origins of the conflict from ancient times to modern days, examining the role of significant biblical events that shape the theological perspectives held by many Christians today. 

We hope this series will equip participants with a well-rounded understanding, enabling them to engage in respectful and informed discussions with people of differing opinions.

July 14:  People of The Covenant
July 21:  History of Violence
July 28:  Ethics of Conquest

We encourage all attendees to come with open hearts and minds, ready to learn and discuss their concerns in a supportive environment. Questions? Contact Lucy Thompson at lucyt@lakeave.org or 626.817.4870.

Un grupo de manifestantes opuestos a la guerra en Gaza se congregó en el Capitolio de Estados Unidos durante la visita del Primer Ministro israelí, Benjamin Netanyahu, para su discurso ante el Congreso. Bajo la organización de Jewish Voice for Peace, vistiendo camisetas rojas que decían "Not In Our Name", ocuparon la Rotonda del edificio Cannon, exigiendo el cese de la violencia en Gaza con gritos de "¡dejen vivir a Gaza!". La policía del Capitolio procedió con arrestos después de advertencias, generando tensiones mientras los manifestantes eran conducidos fuera con las manos atadas. Jane Hirschmann, presente con sus hijas y también arrestada, invocó su experiencia familiar con el Holocausto para criticar las acciones militares. Los manifestantes dirigieron su enojo hacia el gobierno de Biden por su apoyo militar a Israel, reclamando un alto inmediato a los envíos de armas. El número exacto de detenidos aún no se ha confirmado.

JULY 8
#IraqHistory 1982- Dujail is a city of 100K in central #Iraq, with its citizens being predominantly Shia Muslims. The Islamic Dawa Party, a Shia political party, had a strong presence in the town. #SaddamHussein, was a Sunni Arab had become the President of Iraq in 1979 and had ordered the invasion of #Iran, a predominantly Shia country, in Sept 1980. #OTD, Hussein visited Dujail to praise men from the village who were conscripted into the #IranIraqWar. During his motorcade’s exit from the town, a dozen Shia IDP members opened fire from the cover of the date palm orchards lining both sides of the road. Two of Hussein’s bodyguards were killed but the President was uninjured. Hussein ordered his special security and military forces to round up all suspected members of the IDP along with their families. The round-up resulted in 393 men and 394 women and children from Dujail and nearby Balad being detained. Over 40 of the detainees were killed during interrogation while another 140+ were sentenced and executed. Over 400 more were sent into exile. Following Hussein’s capture and conviction after the #IraqWar (2003-11), the dictator was hanged for crimes against humanity partially in connection with the #DujailMassacre.

#IsraelPalestineConflict 1972- Ghassan Kanafani was born in Acre, Mandatory #Palestine in 1936. At the age of 12, Kanafani’s family was forced out of their hometown during the 1948 Palestine #War. The shame Kanafani felt during this time drove his adult life. Kanafani became a political thinker, militant and journalist while also producing several novels, mostly portraying the hardship of Palestinians dispersed throughout the Middle East due to constant war. He was the first #writer to utilize “resistance #literature” in his works from 1966 and 1968 and became considered the leading Palestinian novelist of the Arab world. OTD, Kanafani was assassinated by agents of #Israel’s #Mossad. Kanafani (and his teenage niece) was killed by a grenade
connected to the ignition switch of his car in Beirut. Israel claimed the assassination of Kanafani (a spokesperson of the PFLP) was due to the Lod Airport massacre (see 30 May).

Israel took advantage of the eve of the October 7 Hamas attack to advance its military campaign against the Palestinians. The war spiralling out of Israel’s control ultimately results in a strategic setback. The explainer elucidates the events to put a spotlight on how Israel is failing as a rational actor.

☀️Kiddom Summer Camp and the Rotaract Club of Karachi Kolach joined hands to support the *"Stand with Gaza"* initiative, fostering solidarity and awareness among children. 

⛺The camp featured an engaging tableau where teachers vividly illustrated the complexities of the Israel-Palestine, Iran, and Turkey situation. This creative presentation helped the young participants grasp the historical and political context. 

🎨To further immerse the children in the cause, their faces were painted with the Palestinian flag, symbolizing unity and support.

🌎An informative awareness session educated the children on identifying and avoiding products from Israel, highlighting alternatives they could choose instead. 

🇵🇸A room was transformed to represent Gaza, providing a small yet impactful glimpse into the lives of those affected. This immersive experience helped the children understand the reality of the situation.

🎨Lastly, a hand-printing activity on a large Palestinian flag allowed the kids to leave their mark, symbolizing their support and hope for peace. 

😊 Through these activities, the camp successfully raised awareness and fostered empathy among the young participants.

Singapore is prepared in principle to recognise the State of Palestine, and it believes such a move should help the progress towards peace and a negotiated 2-state solution, Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan told Parliament.

“In particular, there will need to be an effective Palestinian government that accepts Israel’s right to exist and categorically renounces terrorism,” he said. “Both sides have legitimate rights, and both peoples have a right to live in peace and dignity within secure borders.”

Dr Balakrishnan urged both sides to seize the moment to take steps towards a long-lasting peace and put an end to the suffering that has “gone on for too long”.

The ISRAELI 🇮🇱 Government has asked Catholic and Orthodox churches to pay property tax or face legal action.

Israel' targeting Christian presence in Jerusalem: Church heads!

In this time, when the whole world, and the Christian world in particular, are constantly following the events in Israel, we find ourselves, once again, dealing with an attempt by authorities to drive the Christian presence out of the Holy Land," the heads of the Catholic and Orthodox Churches wrote in a letter to Israeli occupation Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

This comes as the heads of the Catholic, Greek Orthodox, and Armenian Orthodox denominations have accused the Israeli occupation of a "coordinated attack" on the Christian presence in Jerusalem due to the decision, by several municipalities, such as Tel Aviv, Ramla, al-Nassira, and Jerusalem, to tax church properties and threatening legal action following failure to do so.

“We believe these efforts represent a coordinated attack on the Christian presence in the Holy Land,” the church leaders wrote.

Church leaders contend that the policy change, which involves taxing their properties, breaks with the longstanding tradition of exemption, an action that will impact the status quo. They further argued that even commercial properties owned by the church should not be taxed since the proceeds support collective services such as schools, hospitals, and care facilities for the elderly and disabled.

In their joint statement, on Sunday, expressing their concern over Jerusalem Municipality's decision to pursue legal action against the churches, the heads of the church said: "We declare that such a measure both undermines the sacred character of Jerusalem and jeopardizes the Church’s ability to conduct its ministry in this land on behalf of its communities and the worldwide church."

The conflict has historical roots. In 2018, when the Israeli-appointed Municipality of occupied Jerusalerevealed its intention to levy property taxes amounting to $174.5 million on church properties not designated for worship, it provoked a significant backlash from the churches.

About 50 Palestinian prisoners arrested during the ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine were released on Monday, including the director of Gaza's largest hospital, Israeli sources confirmed.

An Israeli security official, speaking anonymously to Xinhua, stated that the prisoners were released from various Israeli facilities, including the military detention camp of Sde Teiman in the south, where many Palestinians arrested during the ongoing conflict were held.

The official noted that the release was part of an effort to reduce the number of detainees in Sde Teiman, which is running out of space.

Mohammed Abu Selmia, head of the Al Shifa Hospital, was among those released on Monday. He was detained by Israeli forces in November 2023 while traveling south from Gaza City following an Israeli military raid on the hospital.

Who is the occupier? 
We asked Google.

When examining the history of the land of Israel, it’s essential to look at the timeline of significant historical and religious landmarks.

The First Temple, also known as Solomon’s Temple, was built around 1000 BCE in ancient Jerusalem. 
This temple served as the central place of worship for the Israelites and housed the Ark of the Covenant. 
Its construction marks a significant chapter in the history of the Jewish people, establishing their deep-rooted presence in this land over 2,900 years ago.

In contrast, the Al-Aqsa Mosque, an important Islamic landmark, was constructed much later, in 705 CE.

These dates highlight a substantial historical context. 
The Jewish connection to the land of Israel dates back nearly 3,000 years, long before the advent of Islam. 
This deep historical bond underscores the ancient and enduring connection of the Jewish people to this land.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expects the issuance of arrest warrants by the International Court of Justice (ICC) for him and Defence Minister Yoav Gallant by July 24, according to Israeli media on Wednesday.

On May 20, ICC Prosecutor Karim Khan requested arrest warrants for Netanyahu and Gallant for war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip.

“Netanyahu convened a high-stakes discussion on Tuesday evening about the looming possibility that the ICC might heed the request of its chief prosecutor, Karim Khan, and soon issue arrest warrants against him and Gallant,” Yedioth Ahronoth newspaper said.

The meeting was attended by Justice Minister Yariv Levin, Strategic Affairs Minister Ron Dermer and Attorney-General Gali Baharav-Miara.
