In solchen Momenten muss ich an die Nachricht einer Frau denken, die mich während der Proteste in Iran über Instagram erreicht hat. Was wäre, schrieb die iranische Frau, wenn es die Islamische Republik nicht mehr gäbe? Was, wenn wir es schaffen, das Regime zu stürzen? Die Antworten auf ihre Fragen zielen mitten ins Heute.

• Dann würden wir in einem Land leben, das befreundet wäre mit Israel.

• Dann bräuchte Israel weniger Waffen und Saudi-Arabien auch.

• Es gäbe keinen Krieg im Jemen. Irak könnte seine eigene Politik bestimmen.

• Die Hisbollah und die Hamas hätten keinen Finanzierer mehr.

• Russland würde keine Drohnen und Mittelstreckenraketen mehr geliefert bekommen, die sie im Krieg gegen die Ukraine einsetzen.

• Putin hätte keinen mächtigen Verbündeten mehr in der Region.

• Assad hätte einen Unterstützer weniger.
Die Gefängnisse, in denen politische Gefangenen sitzen, wären leer.

• Man müsste sich nicht mehr fürchten vor einer Atombombe in den Händen der Mullahs.

• Es gäbe einen neuen Markt, der offen wäre für einen enormen Nachholbedarf an Investitionen. Allein für Deutschland 20 Milliarden Investitionen - pro Jahr.

• Und vielleicht wäre eine Frau Präsidentin, die in einem ersten Amtsakt nach Yad Vashem ginge.

Gute Vorstellung. Die bittere Wahrheit ist: Statt das Problem in Iran anzugehen, hilft der Westen dem Brandstifter noch, Holz zu holen. Mit schweren Folgen für die Situation in Israel, wo jetzt ein Flächenbrand droht.

O ministro das Relações Exteriores de Israel, Israel Katz, ameaçou o movimento Hezbollah com uma “guerra total” que levaria o grupo terrorista islâmico xiita à destruição. O Hezbollah tem raízes no Líbano e é fortemente apoiado pelo Irã, ditadura islâmica localizada no Golfo Pérsico.

Ao mesmo tempo em que Israel ataca a Faixa de Gaza para derrotar os terroristas palestinos do Hamas, as tensões têm aumentado na fronteira com o Líbano, que é a sede do Hezbollah, com o fogo cruzado entre o grupo e forças israelenses nas últimas semanas.

Katz deu essas declarações depois que o Hezbollah divulgou imagens que, segundo o grupo terrorista garantiu, foram feitas por um drone em Haifa, cidade portuária no norte de Israel.

FLYADS
“Estamos muito próximos do momento em que decidiremos mudar as regras do jogo contra o Hezbollah e o Líbano. Em uma guerra total, o Hezbollah será destruído e o Líbano será duramente atingido”, disse Katz, de acordo com um comunicado de seu gabinete divulgado na rede X.

De acordo com o ministro israelense, o líder do Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, “se vangloria hoje [terça-feira] de ter fotografado os portos de Haifa, operados por grandes empresas internacionais chinesas e indianas, e de ameaçar danificá-los”.

We should certainly be critical of Hamas and condemn the war crimes committed on Oct 7th. JOIN US ON AN IMPORTANT JOURNEY OF DISCOVERY & DIALOGUE!

We invite our church family on a three-part teaching series exploring the complex and often contentious legacy of the land that both Israelis and Palestinians call home. We will trace the origins of the conflict from ancient times to modern days, examining the role of significant biblical events that shape the theological perspectives held by many Christians today. 

We hope this series will equip participants with a well-rounded understanding, enabling them to engage in respectful and informed discussions with people of differing opinions.

July 14:  People of The Covenant
July 21:  History of Violence
July 28:  Ethics of Conquest

We encourage all attendees to come with open hearts and minds, ready to learn and discuss their concerns in a supportive environment. Questions? Contact Lucy Thompson at lucyt@lakeave.org or 626.817.4870.

“When someone shows you who they are,” Maya Angelou said, “believe them the first time.” That should apply to foreign-policy elites who show you who they are, time after time. Officials running the Pentagon and State Department have been in overdrive for more than 250 days in support of Israel’s ongoing slaughter of Palestinian civilians in Gaza. Supposedly dedicated to defense and diplomacy, those officials have worked to implement and disguise Washington’s war policies, which have taken more lives than any other government in this century.

Among the weapons of war, cluster munitions are especially horrific. That’s why 67 Democrats and an equal number of Republicans in the House of Representatives voted last week to prevent the U.S. government from continuing to send those weapons to armies overseas. But more than twice as many House members voted the other way. They defeated a Pentagon funding amendment that would have prohibited the transfer of cluster munitions to other countries. The lawmakers ensured that the U.S. can keep supplying those weapons to the military forces of Ukraine and Israel.

As of now, 124 nations have signed onto a treaty banning cluster munitions, which often wreck the bodies of civilians. The “bomblets” from cluster munitions “are particularly attractive to children because they resemble a bell with a loop of ribbon at the end,” the Just Security organization explains.

Poster ini mengingatkan kembali nilai-nilai persaudaraan (ukhuwah) dan toleransi (tasamuh) yang menjadi fondasi kuat dalam menjaga solidaritas dan kedamaian di tengah masyarakat Palestina. Di tengah konflik berkepanjangan, prinsip-prinsip ini membantu mereka tetap tegar dan bersatu.

Poster ini dibuat dengan jenis font yang beragam namun tetap serasi, menandakan beragamnya masyarakat Islam yang mempunyai tujuan sama, yaitu menjunjung tinggi kemerdekaan masyarakat Palestina. Ilustrasi anak kecil berbaju putih yang memegang bendera Palestina melambangkan ketulusan hati masyarakat setempat dalam memperjuangkan kemerdekaan negara mereka. Nuansa hijau pada poster memberikan kesan yang lebih Islami.

Mari kita memahami dan menghargai perjuangan mereka, serta mendukung perdamaian yang adil. 🌿✌️🇵🇸

Tragically, many young people are prepared for violence rather than peace. To pave the way for a hopeful future, we must address these influences and advocate for a world where children can thrive free from the horrors of war. Every child deserves a chance to grow up in peace!

The Palestinian group Islamic Jihad fired a barrage of rockets into Israel on Monday as fighting raged in Gaza and Israeli tanks advanced deeper in parts of the enclave, residents and officials said.

Islamic Jihad said its fighters fired rockets toward several Israeli communities near the fence with Gaza in response to "the crimes of the Zionist enemy against our Palestinian people".

The volley of about 20 rockets caused no casualties, the Israeli military said. But the attack showed they possess rocket capabilities almost nine months into an offensive that Israel says is aimed at neutralising threats against it.

Residents of several neighbourhoods in eastern Khan Younis, which is in southern Gaza, said they had received audio messages from Israeli phone numbers ordering them to leave their homes.

“Make it a post” they said! 
For those asking how should a Christian view the Israel - Palestine conflict ? 

I hope you can see what my main point is - not to do with war, but salvation. 

Yk, even I was not exactly with Israel when this all began. But God made us fast and pray for Israel as a Church. Then my eyes were opened to the scriptures and who Israel is to us, even today. 

“For the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.” Romans 11:29

Am I biased towards Israel? No. But the irony is the amount of people who are biased against Israel, the victims in this war. 

Yes I am aware that the death count caused by Israel is way higher than by Palestine. You know what else is true? Who started the war. And who paid the price. Civilian Israeli hostages still haven’t been returned yet. 

The manifesto of Hamas is to finish Israel. Israel is trying to maintain its existence and spare as many civilians in offending territories as possible, and being faulted for it. 

Let atleast the adopted family of Israel (non Israeli Christians) know that without this nation, our place before God also stands shaken. Ofcourse, God will not allow that to happen. But woe to those to say they love the God of Israel but not Israel. 

Yes, love does not mean love war. I’m only talking about the basics- pray for Israel’s salvation. 
Yes, pray the same for Palestine too. 

If you happen to be a Palestinian reading this, know that I am for you. 
Just don’t expect me to be against my Israeli family. 

Please read the pics carefully before you make a judgment. 

#israel #godofisrael #adoptedisraelite

An argument that has arisen since hamas’ brutal October 7th massacre, which saw nearly 1,200 Jews and Israelis dead, & around a further 250 taken hostage. This argument is proportionality and this argument, whether you know it or not, has deep antisemitic roots. Although it is not an argument that has been publicly used before, it is one that seems to have only been used since Israel, retaliated & went to war with hamas. Legally, Israel has a duty to protect its own people from genocide & as hamas have said, given the chance, that they will commit the atrocities of October 7th over and over again, Israel also has the right to defend herself. 

Using this against Israel, when they are fighting a war against terrorists who imbed themselves in civilian infrastructure & use their own as human shields, shifts the responsibility away from hamas and their duty as the elected governing body to protect its own. It also shifts the responsibility away from those responsible for the brutal massacre on October 7th. 

“Proportionality in war does not mean balancing number of lives lost, or buildings leveled…Proportionality is one of the core principles of the law of war—to which all recognized states have agreed. Distorting the meaning of the term undermines the values it is meant to protect.”

The IDF, have gone beyond the lengths taken during any other modern warfare, to protect Palestinian civilians & avoid casualties, which is more than can be said for hamas, who use the deaths of their civilians as a PR strategy.

But if we must talk about proportionality, perhaps we could turn our attention to the first intifada, an almost 6 year long war, which was ignited after an Israeli vehicle crashed into two vans carrying Palestinian workers, tragically killing four of them. Israel have said the crash was accidental, however Palestine saw this as revenge for the death of an Israeli a mere few days before. Whether the car crash was an accident or not, does this response seem proportionate to you?

अल-कुद्स में यह शख़्स बहुत प्यार और पहचान के हक़दार हैं। इनका नाम अबू ख़दीजा है ये पुराने शहर यरुशलम में अपना छोटा कैफे चलाते हैं यहूदी और दूसरे विदेशी लोगों की तरफ से इन्हे कैफे बेचने के लिए 36 मिलियन डॉलर तक की पेशकश की गई थी लेकिन इन्होने ये रकम ठुकरा दी।

असल में इनके कैफे के नीचे एक सुरंग है जो मस्जिद-अल-अक्सा तक जाती है, इसलिए अबु ख़दीजा ने इसे बेचने से इनकार कर दिया।

उन्होंने कहा कि यह जमीन पूरी उम्मत की है और मैं इस दुनिया में किसी भी कीमत पर इसका एक इंच भी हिस्सा नहीं दूंगा।

A confirmação final foi recebida: Ibrahim Akil, chefe da equipe de operações da organização terrorista Hezbollah, foi morto em um ataque em Beirute, no Líbano. 

O porta-voz das FDI anunciou que, sob a orientação precisa da Divisão de Inteligência, os caças da Força Aérea atacaram a área de Beirute e mataram Ibrahim Akil, o chefe da equipe de operações do Hezbollah, o comandante interino da unidade Radwan e o comandante do “Plano para a conquista da Galiléia”.

 No ataque, junto com Akil, os principais agentes e a cadeia de comando da unidade Raduan foram eliminados. Akil e os comandantes eliminados estavam entre os arquitetos do "plano para a ocupação da Galiléia", no qual o Hezbollah planejava no dia da ordem invadir o território do Estado de Israel, ocupar os assentamentos da Galiléia, assassinar e matar inocentes, à semelhança do que a organização terrorista Hamas levou a cabo no massacre homicida de 7 de Outubro.

O túnel era tão apertado que eles tinham dificuldade para ficar em pé e apenas dois deles podiam se deitar simultaneamente. Eles enfrentaram falta de ventilação e foram forçados a usar água destinada ao consumo também para banho, sem acesso a banheiros ou chuveiros.
